text: Classic lighter dubbel- caramel nutmeg rich malts, candi sugar, and a touch of banana Belgian yeast. Definitely a nice Belgian drinker.

.33l bottle at home. Hazy brown beer, shallow aromas, hints of brown sugar and caramel. Taste is rather sweet. Strong malt flavour. Palate is thick, medium carbonation. Flaky yeast is present in the bottle, I poured some yeast along with the beer.. hehe.

Overall not too bad. Not that special of a beer.

backlog

Aroma: malty, candy sugar, and some dark fruits.

Taste: malty, candy sugar, dark fruits and some yeast notes.
Pretty much a lighter version of Prior 8. Hazy brown color with medium head. Aroma: dark fruits, candy sugar, nutmeg and barley. Taste: Plums, dates, raisins, toffee, Belgian yeast and spice.

Dark semi-sweet chocolate, with banana, pear and doughy aromas. Not as much depth of flavor or aroma as I was expecting. Light and fizzy as it should be with a slightly salty aftertaste. Ok but just an average dubbel. Their Prior 8 is much better .
Det er slet ikke en dårlig øl, den smager bare ikke af så meget. Men man bliver som så ikke glad i hovedet! Den er fin fin, ikke noget særligt faktisk ..

Bought this in a mixed 4 pack, including a Bernardus chalice. Had my doubts when the cashier reached for a tissue to wipe off the dust... so I asked her how long it had been on the shelves and got a reassuring answer. Hopefully, the remaining 3 brews, at higher ABV, have not lost their flavor. The bottle says best before end and is dated 08 07 17 and here we are at 05 29 17. This one didnt make it. Very disappointing selection from an otherwise quality bottle shop.
Piwo skonsumowane. Ocena na podstawie retrospekcji w celu uzupełnienia profilu.

Originally rated on 12/24/08. The first offering from my christmas gift 4 pack. It poured a beautiful ruby light brown body with a thin off white cap. Aroma was kinda average because there very, very slight hints of malt, banana, cinnamon, with some fruit. Flavor was better with the fruit and spices and the malt finish showing a bit more. overall it was a pretty decent brew, very drinkable.
Pohodové a zajímavé pivo s krásnou nasládlou vůní a jemným řízem.. Chuťově hodně dobré.

Butelka 0,33l. pite w domu. Kolor bursztynowy, mętny, piana solidna trzyma się dobrze. Aromat owocowy z lekkim zapachem skórek chlebowych. Rześkie w smaku, owocowe ze śliwkami suszonymi na pierwszym planie. Lekkie, nie czuć alkoholu, przyjemne w piciu.

Pater 6 is most appropriately described with adjectives like "rustic," "cohesive," and - big surprise here - "Belgian." This Abbey Dubbel pours a brown color that reveals a dark amber when held to the light. Malty, nutty, and fruity aromas. Hazelnut, caramel apple, chocolate, brown sugar, and raising showed up in my tasting. Soft, mostly sweet palate with just a hint of hops. Lovely.

This is a complex rather busy chestnut coloured beer; perhaps the 6.7 ABV accounts for the smallish head that quickly became a thin layer but stays the course. 
As I nose the beer there is the typical Belgian yeastiness, dark fruits and caramel perhaps a little herbal note. 
I raise the glass to find it's highly carbonated and fizzes in the mouth - it's a little thinner than I expected for a darker beer but medium smooth.
Yeast and fruit come in rapid succession with a spirited but not over bitter slightly herbal background (just about where I like it) that takes its time teasing the tongue. Then mellowing out to a balanced brown sugar and caramel aftertaste, but wait for it... when that's faded the herbal bitterness takes on a sharp metallic edge (remember boiled sweet acid drops?) and goes on and on and....
Again, part of the holiday 6-pack, not the best of the pack, but definitely above average.

On tap.

Tomada en el Kraken de caña.
Rojiza, suave, dulce de caramelo y pasas.
La St Bernardus Prior 8 y Abt 12 son superiores.
Esta es la hermana pequeña.

Facil de beber.
Poca graduacion.
Pours ruby colour with a big off white head. Aroma is dark fruits, bread, carmel and honey. Dark fruit and brown sugar flavours with a light bitter and full body. Good but not great.

Amber colour, small that fades soon, good lace. Aroma of dark fruits, figs, plums, chocolate, caramel, bananas. Almost full, thick rouch palate with an overall carbonation.
Taste is similar to the aroma, caramel, dark fruits, chocolate. Good.

A 330ml bottle with a best before date of 8th February 2018. Poured into a Chimay goblet. It was a dark brown-reddish colour with a very nice creamy two finger beige head that slowly dissipates to a thin but self-replenishing layer while leaving nice lacing. Aromas of dark fruits, plum, fig, raisins and apple with hints of caramel. Tastes similar to the aroma with dark fruit, plum, fig, raisins and prunes with some banana, light caramel and hints of nuttiness. Medium to light bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall, the dark fruit is there, but it disappeared quite fast. Other than that, it was easy to drink, but not nearly as good as one of my favourite Dubbels like Westmalle Dubbel.

0,33 l bottle. Pours reddish brown with big frothy tan dissipating head. Aroma is malt, bread, yeast, some toffee caramel and dried fruit. Flavor is dominated by malts. Light sweetness is complemented with noticeable peppery bitterness. Body is full and rounded, texture is slick, carbonation lively. Finish is long and bitter. Very nice.

AROMA: bread, 
APPEARANCE: brown, hazy, frothy, white foam, 
TASTE: medium bitterness, 
PALATE: light body, thin feel, soft carbonation, abrupt
OVERALL: disappointing, boring aroma, watery thin.
Bottle. Chestnut color, hazy liquid, white head. Aroma is malty, oak, liquor, but also a bit of yeasts and grass. Medium bitter. Good.

The aroma of the farmhouse, yeast and hay. The taste is quite similar. OK bitterness which fills the upper part of the mouth a weak moment. No good beer. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Bottle.

A- Cola, dark fruits.

A- Mahogany color, clear liquid, off white head.

T- Cola, dark fruit.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, balanced finish.

O- Lots of sweet malts and dark fruits. Not quite as complex as I hoped it might be.

Pours with good foam that stays for a while. Color is of dark brown mead. Aroma is filling with bread and yeast, nuts and seeds, olive oil, salt, pizza, soy sauce. Aroma is clearly more salty than sweet. Palate is very well balanced and the carbonation is nice. Taste follows the sensations of aromas in the sense that this is a more salty than sweet beer and that the taste has roasted bread, some malted grains, wheat flour, some pizza aromas. An okay beer, but not a personal favorite from the St. Bernardus range.

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2017 Bottle 0,33L. Poured well chilled into a 0,25 beer glass. Dark buckwheat honey color. Thin threads of bubbles, medium carbonation. The head is brown. The aroma is subdued and delicate: malt, bread and soy sauce. The taste is of brown sugar, malt and coffee. Rather full body. Heaty and filling. Love it and will buy again. USD2.44

Bottle 0,33. Pours chestnut with medium off-white foamy head, nice lacing. Aroma yeast, malts, toffee, brown sugar, dried fruits. Taste follows the aroma, somewhat sweet with brown sugar and raisins in the aftertaste. Medium body and carbonation.

Bottle as gift. Pours deep brown with a foamy beige head. Aromas of Cola Cubes, toffee malt and a gentle orange sherbet. Flavours of warm, spicy stewed apples and a light orange and lemon zest. Surprising light, sparkly body. This looked heavy but was beautifully light and sweet with real zesty refreshment. A seriously nice beer.

Bottle. Another icon that Im surprised to find Ive never recorded notes on this. As advertised, it is indeed chestnut colored, and emblematic of the style. Rich and sugary, tightly weaved, nutty, and sweet. My "score" may seem a bit low just because Im not a huge fan of the style. (#6508, 2/17/2017)

Bottle. Reddish-Brown in colour. Fruity (dried fruits and berries). Malty (caramel, toffee, candy sugar, chocolate). Spicy & Yeasty (some floaties & sediment). Sweetish with bitter hoppy edge. Nice. (2008)

Pours with a big, thick head but dissipates to a ring quickly; copper-brown colour. The aroma is Belgian yeast and brown sugar. The taste is breadiness, caramel and dark fruits with a spicy, dry finish. Light-medium body, rather fizzy in the mouthfeel. A solid dubbel but expected more.

mittelbraun, trüb mit fast sahnigem beigem Schaum. süßlich malzig, leicht geröstet. Brotig getreidiger Geschmack, etwas Karamell und getrocknete Früchte. leichte und nachklingende Bittere. Tolles Bier.
Sample with some friends, brown beer, medium head. Aroma is malt, caramel. Taste is the same, quite sweet, not bad.
fajne lekkie piwko, poprawne bez wiekszych zaskoczen, wyczuwlne nuty skorki czarnego chleba, pozytwne zieolone jabuszko idace w strone papierowki, zapch owocy momentami podchodzacy pod owece lasu

33 cl Bottle - bbd= 2012 
Has aged very well, exquisit taste. Developed wonderfully into a rich dark beer, full of body and layers.
Bottle from WOB in Destin. Im not a big Dubbel drinker but this is just a good beer. Full bodied with a great slightly sweet malt taste.

33cl bottle at home. Appearance: clear chestnut brown with medium eggshell white head. Aroma: roasted malts, bread, grains and some red fruits. Taste: medium sweetness and medium bitterness. Notes of red fruits, berries, roasted malts and a trace of spice/cinnamon. Palate: medium bodied, oily texture and lively carbonation. Good sweetness and balance.

Rating #2414 - 2016.04.09 - Bottle from St Bernardus mixer. Dark brown/amber colour with a tan head. Aroma is soft fruits, ripened berry. raisin. Taste is light, grainy and sweet fruits. Quite pleasantly spiced and extremely smooth on the finish. Dark, lighter body and quite nice.

Pours mahogany brown with high off-white head. Aroma is caramel, old floor cleaning swab, raisin, light dried fruits, some roast, light cinnamon, nuts, light rotten eggs. Taste is nuts, oily, some malts, caramel, butterscotch, some dark sauce, dark fruits, red grapes. Nice beer!

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2017 From boxbeers; brown red with a huge slightly offwhite head; aroma is fruity yeasty, gentle spicy, sugary, slightly earthy; taste is caramel, dark sugar, malty grainy, fruity, banana, spicy hoppy, low to medium bitter finish with grainy notes; mouthfeel is thick with high carbonation and medium body
Deliciosa en nariz con sus notas de plátano muy maduro, caramelo y un fondo cítrico y ligeramente picante. Muy equilibrada en boca.
Has a very fresh, fruity aroma with some caramel in it. It tastes not as sweet as it smells, but is a very nice balanced brew instead. Very easy to drink.

Decent representative of the abbey dubbel style.
hay, perfume, orange, raisin, cherry, bubblegum, apricot
red / brown, clear, medium, frothy, tan foam, 
light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
full body, thick feel, average carbonation, metal, abrupt finish

Pours a deep Burgundy brown with a huge tan foamy head. Lots of sediment. Medium carbonation with lots of lacing. Aroma is crisp and tart with dark fruit and spices. Crisp and clean with a full mouth tingly feel. Smooth with dark fruity taste and a nice finish. Flavors are goo but dnt linger long enough. Decent aftertaste. Very good but not great.
Brown body with a one finger bubbly foo white head. It is overcarbonated and the body is light to medium.Aromas of yeast,malt,caramel, Tastes sweet,earthy notes,some spices,caramel.
12 oz bottle out of sample pack pours dark brown with tan head quite a bit of lacing lots of debris. Very smooth slightly roasted flavor.

Hazy brown, moderate white head. Lacing present. Complex aroma of caramel, spicy yeast, candy, dark fruit. Medium body. Surprisingly dry taste. Bread, caramel, dried fruit, Belgian yeast. Light balancing bitterness. High class.

330ml Bottle: Pours a dark brown with large tan head that persists. Aroma of caramel and dark fruits. Tastes of dark fruits and caramel with hints of bread crust and toffee. Low bitterness with smooth finish. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Overall a great beer.
Bottle, Ann Arbor, MI via Mulmur. Opaque brown. Soapy head. Sweet metallic caramel aroma. Mild flavour. Sweet brown sugar and faint hop finish.
Intense caramel, red/dark fruits, notes of alcohol, amber/light brown with practicallly no head, medium body, fizzy, caramel again with dried fruits...a very good dubbel monk!!!

Robe brune, mousse abondante et crémeuse; Nez assez élégant sur des notes de café froid, de chocolat, dépices, sur un fond lacté, belle complexité. Bouche à lattaque ample, belle rétro torréfiée, une fine bulle, de la fraîcheur, de la rondeur, et une finale équilibrée. De fait une très belle brune équilibrée et complexe. Une bière qui allie ampleur et fraîcheur. Un délice.

Pours dark amber colour with off white medium size head. Aroma of dark bread, coffee, caramel. Medium sweet, light bitter, no sourness. Medium body, thick feel, average carbinization, very nice light burned bitter aftertaste.
Bottle 33cl. Dark brown with a loose off white head. Aroma of grain, malts. The taste is surprisingly bitter, a bit metallic. Hints of pepper. The aftertaste is not much different.

Mahogany. Spicy aroma with noble hops and dark kandis, and a pungent, phenolic, peppery flavour. Full, somewhat dry taste with a dry, bitter and slightly astringent finish. Medium body and high carbonation. Overall, a very good dubbel. Strong, spicy and complex.

Pours hazy brown with a short-lasting tan head. The aroma contains malts, yeast, raisin, dark fruits, spices and some caramel. It tastes medium sweet and light sour. Medium body and creamy mouthfeel. In all aspects the little brother of the St. Bernardus beers.

6%ABV. Abbey ale.

Poured out amber. 12°SRM.

Nose has stone dust, dried wood, cement dust, light mustiness. On closer inspection, acorns, chestnuts and black bread. Moldy leather.

Mouthfeel is beery. Palate is juicy with some light sour roundness. Palate has toasted malt, sweet dough, Graham cracker, honey, fresh dates. Mineral finish.

Finish is sweet, light and brief bitter.

Deep amber with a medium light beige head. Aroma is prunes, grapes, apples, caramel, honey, some wood, herbal and floral notes. Taste is caramel, chocolate, prunes, hazelnut, honey, biscuit. Light sweet aftertaste. Warming. Excellent!
Bottle. Dark brown with huge tan head. Aroma is classic belgian, yeast and dark fruits. Taste is mild. Dark fruits, yeast and some bread. Mild beer, in this style a bit anonymous taste in my opinion.

Ganska vit krona som är bra! Grumlig mörk sirapsfärg, doften är söt, brödig, mörk sirap som också går igenom smaken med en jäst smak av kolsyra och viss humlighet 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Amber to brown with big off-white head. Aroma is fruity, banana, peach, apple, touch of herbs and biscuits and hazelnuts. Taste is light sweet, light bitter, malty background. Light body, slick texture, soft carbonation.

Pullo @ Bierpaleis, Brugge. Kaatuu lasiin punertavan ruskeana ja hieman sameana, vaahto on parin sormen paksuinen ja melko pysyvä. Tuoksussa on makeaa sokerisuutta, kuivattua hedelmää ja mausteisuutta. Maussa on makeaa kuivattua hedelmää, puppurista mausteisuutta, mutta loppu on vähän tyhjä. Suutuntuma on makeahko, hiilihappoinen ja suht kepeä. Dubbel on vähän tylsä tyyli ja monesti ylimakea, mutta tämä onnistui välttämään sen. Loppumaku on valitettavasti vähän tyhjän oloinen.

Belle robe brune avec reflets rouge rubie et mousse ivoire peu persistante .
Bonne carbonatation.Arômes de vin qui apparaissent très vite en début de nez puis sestompent pour laisser la place aux céréales.En bouche arrivent des saveurs maltées,fruitées et épicées avec une douce amertume.
Une bière agréable et fraîche pour une brune Dubbel qui nous laisse sur une note houblonnée !

Dégustée dans un verre Maredsous.
Robe brune cuivrée, carbonatation très faible et mousse beige fine mais assez tenace.
Le nez est levuré avec quelques arômes dépices.
Le goût continue sur une levure(une saveur que je napprécie pas habituellement!) qui se révèle agréable.
La brasserie conseille de boire entre 6° et 10° mais je pense quil est bon de prendre son temps et de laisser un peu réchauffer...
Du coup une douceur bienvenue fait son apparition et amène des touches de caramel.
Larrière bouche est de longueur moyenne et légère avec une petite amertume appréciable.
Une très bonne double.

Appearance: bright dark copper, great tan head
Aroma: spicy apples, raisins, bread
Mouthfeel: medium Mouthfeel, high carbonation
Taste: nutty, spices, alcohol
Lighter Mouthfeel than expected for a dubbel but otherwise great

Style et résumé: Double classique (benchtmark). 
Comment: Bouteille de 33cl. A 24 08 17
Description: Un liquide brun noisette translucide. Une belle mousse beige à grosses bulles se dresse au sommet. Un nez dépices, clou, fruits confits, sucre brun. Une bouche tout aussi épicée, avec des fruits secs et une touche de sucre. Une des deux bouteilles avait des goûts de contamination.
Note:  7+/10

Perfect, drinktemperature is on the label.
Cloudy brown beer with a stable cappuccino head, fizzy carbonation, typical Belgian yeast and this is dominated, smell is Belgian yeast and dark fruits, light body for this style, thin texture, bread, good balance, better for the cold days, finish dry, very good beer,
(I have 0.33l bottle with best-before A 19 10 17)

Cant believe I finally tried this, wow, well, ok, this was poured into a chalice.
The appearance was a ruddy dark brown color with a fingers worth of white to off white foamy head that dissipated within less than a minute. Glossy filmy lacing clung and then slid into the glass nicely.
The aroma starts off with sweet iced apples, sly Belgian spices of allspice, ginger, and sweet cake to bready raison-like fruitiness. Comes together really damn good!
The flavor takes all of the previously mentioned flavors to meld in a nice refined sweet to spicy sort of way. Normal Belgian quickening throatiness doesnt harden on my throat in the aftertaste or finish like a fair amount of other Americanized- Belgian Dubbels.
On the palate, this one sits about a light to medium in body with a great sessionability about it. Carbonation rides light. ABV barely feels there.
Overall, love it for what it is, and would love to come back to this perhaps a bit later this Autumn. In my opinion, probably one of the best Belgian Dubbels on the market and we can get this in the USA. Everything just comes together so damn good!

Bottle. Pours brown with thick, light tan head and lacing. Nose of raisin, some brown sugar, and bread crust with a little alcohol. Bread crust malt and raisins. Thinner body than expected. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Clear brown colour with small head off. Aroma of caramelized sugar, belgian yeasts. Taste is sweet, caramel, chocolate, plumbs .Dry finish. Enjoyed it.

aroma: simple caramel, some dry leaves, earthy, gentle vanilla, some nuts as well. 
amber red, hazy, tan foam, minimal head, ok retention. taste is similar to aroma, with a gentle tone of alcohol warming. light sweetness, very lightly bitter. body is light to medium,slick feel, average carbonation, long finish that takes on notes of dry leaves and sweetness. Overall: the 8 version is better in every aspect, this somewhat falls behind.
UPDATED: AUG 17, 2016 Subtle fruit notes. Medium bitterness. Not too sweet. Subtle caramel. Slightly creamy. Medicinal hint far away.Works well with gnocchi, chicken and a mustard cream sauce.

Kolor br?z kasztanowy z rubinowymi refleksami, czysty, klarowny. Piana g?sta, zwarta i trwa?a. Jest w kolorze z?amanej bieli, pozostawia mnóstwo zdobien.
Aromat palonych s?odów, s? pieczone kasztany, orzechy, jest lekko torfowo ziemisty, pojawia si? wanilia i troch? jakby ?ció?ka drzewna.
Smak ziemisty, lekka palono??, pieczone kasztany, karmel, ponownie wanilia i ziemia.
Wysycenie ?rednie idealnie wpasowuje si? w "spokojny" charakter tego piwa.
Uwagi: bardzo ciekawe i z?o?one piwo, zdecydowanie degustacyjne.

Appearance: clear dark brown with shrinking brown head.
Aroma: malt.
Taste: bitter, some sweet.
Palate: medium body, moderate carbonation.
Overall: nice.

Biscuit and caramel notes. Fresh dry sweet. Low bitterness. Fine brew. Alcohol well hidden. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle bought at Good Stuff in Yuen Long.
Looks: Clear chestnut brown colour with a very thin trace of yeast particles; Two finger head with crumpety and creamy light-beige foam which lasts for 3 minutes; Beautiful sticky lacing with active small carbonation.

Aroma: Fragrant and sweet dark malt, with strong caramel, strong sticky toffee, vanilla, plums, raisins, light chocolate, light cream, alcohol, icing sugar, brown sugar, dark bread, strong Bel yeast and thin grass. It gets pretty complex and pleasant when it gets warmer. Nice!

Taste: Mid to light sweet dark malt, with strong metallic, caramel, light toffee, light plums, light molasses, spices, very dry dark bread, Bel yeast, very light lemon, fair bitter hops and grass.

Body: Medium. Dry, very slick and creamy palate.

Mouth Feel: Fairly solid dark malt in a pretty rich, smooth and metallic background, creamy all the way. Strong non-sweet caramel and toffee with light plums, notes of molasses then it gets pretty spicy, very dry rye bread yeastiness with light lemon to round. Some strong impression of English Ales dryness here. Very nice!

Hoppiness: Thin grass in nose. Spices, light lemon and grass in taste; Bitterness is light to moderate for a lasting, fairly astringent biscuity caramel malt finish. 

After Taste: Very dry. Bready and fairly bitter to mouth.

Comments: This one is well executed with good looks, complex caramel dark aroma, very dry bready and low-sweet taste with encompass lots of flavors in a conservative manner. Theres some good dry English characters in this 100% Belgian Dubbel. A beauty!
Full of classic Belgian flavours... bread, yeast, ripe banana, raisins.. full bodied considering the ABV, rich, think mouthfeel. Really good.

Clear mahogany with bit ruby, very light sparkling, huge beige creamy head dissipates through turning frothy/rocky and leaving patchy lacing. Dry aroma, malty,bit cellar tones, chalk, earthy notes. Medium body, lively carbonation, sweet and malty, bread, raisins, caramel, honey, bit herbs, medium long. Quite tasty.

Bouteille avec un BB du 24/08/2017. Robe brune foncée très trouble avec un généreux col de mousse blanchâtre et assez onctueux. Arômes de malt caramélisé, épices, raisins, un peu de sucre dorge et noisettes. Quelques petits fruits confits en arrière-plan. En bouche, malt caramelisé, petits fruits confits plus présents quau nez, orange, sucre dorge, un peu de houblons herbacés, noisettes, raisins, pruneaux séchés. Finale plus sèche et où les levures belges ressortent plus ainsi que des saveurs plus terreuses. Texture légèrement onctueuse et corps moyen.
0,33l Bottle, Beerlovers Vienna. Aroma hoppy, sweet, nut. Amber red color, with creamy head. Taste fruity, caramel, nut, sweet and bitter at the end.

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2016 0.33l bottle. Slightly hazy dark orange body, thin off-white head. Aroma of caramel, figs, orange zest and raisins. Taste of caramel, orange zest, toast, figs, honey and floral hops. Very nice dubbel.
Nez neutre. Bouche très légère pour une brune. Notes un peu herbacée. Un peu de caramel. Finale un peu courte. Bonne dans lensemble. Ne pas boire trop froide.
Espuma pouca e rápida. Aroma de maltês torrados e figos. Gosto segue o aroma com carbonatação boa e retrogosto agradável. Esperava um pouco mais de maltes e caramelo.
11.2 oz. bottle, consumed in hotel room in Kansas City. Poured brown, good tan head. Aroma of toasted bread, plums and raisins. Taste was slight sweet, figs and toasted malt.

Coloração marrom escura, creme branco, de boa formação. Aroma de malte, caramelo e leveduras, mas muito suave. Na boca, sabor predominante de caramelo, com toque de figos e ameixa, e um final de amêndoas. O sabor, assim como o aroma, é bem discreto e equilibrado. Boa carbonatação. É uma cerveja boa, mas eu esperava um sabor mais proeminente e vívido, típico do estilo. Harmonizou bem com Roquefort, nozes e salame.

0.33l bottle. Dark red color with tanned head. Aroma of dark fruits, caramel, sugar and raisins. Taste is sweet with chocolate notes and light bitterness. Medium to full body. Overall its very nice and complex ale.
Piwo w kolorze ciemno brazowym, metne z bardzo mala piana. W aromacie ciemne owoce. W smaku czuc przyprawy, rodzynki i slodycz. Piwo z niskim wysyceniem. Lekkie i przyjemne.

bottle to sampler glass. the medium cola brown color with white head gives the aroma of heaven. somewhat belgianese and some dark fruit. nice yeasty nose. the flavor held the same nice sweet malt mixed with dark fruits and that Belgian yeast this just does not get any better..amazing beer.

Great aroma and appearance. Creamy off white head. Dark Amber to brown color. Fruity malt flavor slightly dominated by deeper roast malts. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Caramel, some dark fruits and molasses in nose. Pours dark brown with beige head. Taste is medium sweet with caramel, raisins, chocolate and some spices. Finish is low bitter with very pleasant almond note in the aftertaste. Overall good Dubbel, Ive never tried a beer with such a distinct almond note, interesting.

330 ml bottle. Pours brown with a large off-white head. Aroma of lightly roasted malt and grain as well as earthy and yeasty notes. Watery body with quiet lively carbonation. Taste is a little sweet and acidic with roasted malts (caramel) and subtle notes of mead with a nutty and little alcoholic aftertaste.

Aroma: Medium-light toasted bread with light syrup that quickly disappears. Medium spiciness, coriander, Light fruity, banana. No hops.
Appearance: Slightly hazy, copper body. Large, frothy, rocky head, fair retention. Lacing.
Flavour: Medium coriander, Light toasted bread with syrup. Medium-light bitterness. Very dry finish with lingering coriander.
Mouthfeel: Light warming. Medium-high carbonation, Light body. Light oily tongue coating. Medium-light astringency.
Overall: Missing the maltiness that is expected of the style. The coriander is front and center, and it refuses to move, overpowering everything else, even hanging around afterwards to annoy me.

330 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Andre!
26B. Belgian Dubbel
Well balanced. Caramel, dark fruit, a slight sweet bitterness taste towards the end.
Ruby light brown. Thin tan head. Caramel. Dark fruit. Mild to moderate spice. A touch of alcohol. A little earthy bitterness. Good balance. Nice to get so much flavor without all the abv.

Kastanjekleurig donkerere dubbel met een beetje schuim. De kraag is crèmekleurig. Aromas: Donker fruit, karamel, iets metalig. Geen hops in de neus. Smaak: Een prettig zuurtje, karamel geroosterde mouten, kruidig (wat in combinatie met aardig wat koolzuur een prikkeling aan de zijkant van de tong geeft), donkere fruitsoorten en een aardige nabitter. Koolzuur is flink actief in de mond, redelijk volle body. Scherp / bitter in de afdronk. Heerlijk!

It pours murky mahogany with copper highlights; the head is beige and mousse-like. The aroma has notes of: figs, dark fruit, raisins, and dark bread. The taste is medium sweet that finishes lightly bitter; there are notes of: toffee, banana, bubblegum, and sourdough. The palate is medium bodied with light carbonation and a medium finish. Overall, a more refreshing version of the abt 12.
UPDATED: MAY 5, 2016 From elcervecero. In La Trappe chalice. Playing South Park The Stick of Truth. Fruity, like melon. Not a profile I like much but it isnt difficult to drink either

0,3 bottle. Pours murky dark brown color with small, mostly lasting white head. Yeasty, malty aroma with note of nuts. Flavor is light to medium sweet, caramel, dried fruits. Light bitter. Short bitter, nutty finish. Medium to full body, average carbonation.

Opaque ruby brown hue with a mid sized beige head. Robust aroma consisting of caramel, brown sugar, licorice, dried plum and berries. Full bodied and extremely malt forward. Flavour profile remains true to the aroma. Rich, decadent, and delicious.
Bouteille 33 cl- couleur noir comme un coca, mousse beige, nez sur le caramel, goût : fruits, caramel épices, onctueuse, final sur le caramel dur et sur les épices

Flaska från Beergium. Mörkgrumlig mörk mahognybrun med högt fluffigt beiget skum. Doft av torkad och övermogen frukt; torkade plommon, johannesbröd, russin, lite inlagda körsbär, skumbanan. Halvstor kropp, något torr. Torrheten balanserar upp sötman fint, liksom även den avslutande beskan. Lite choklad, muscovadosocker och kola i smaken med. Riktigt bra. Skulle nog göra sig riktigt bra av att ligga ner ett par år eller mer.

Ruby brown colour. Slight layer of white froth on top. Barley in the aroma. Bready beginning. Slight sweetness in the middle. Hints of caramel in the end and some alcohol. Quite well balanced, but not so interesting abbey beer. Quite well drinkable thow.

Aroma esteroso de la leva y caramelo
Buen color y carbónatacion correcta con espuma dejando encaje de Bruselas
En boca maltosa y caramelo con un final seco y amargo que equilibra el trago

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: red apples, fruits, esters, roasted dark malts.
Appearance: slightly hazy amber color and white head.
Taste: peachy, belgian phenols, red apples, roasted dark malts, warming alcohol, quite dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, roasted finish.
Overall: Strange, far away from being an abbey dubbel.
33cl bottle. Hazy dark brown beer with a large off white head. Sweet, fruity, alcohol aroma, taste is initially caramel, with fruit and Christmas cake flavours coming through
Some malt and and a little ripe fruit aroma. Dark brown, medium long tan head. Taste is complex, with spices, herbs, roasted bitterness, low sweetness. Creamy texture, a bit thin.

Aroma: Kruidig
Appearance: Bruin, sterke lichtbruine schuimkraag
Taste: Bruine suiker, kruidig
Palate: Beetje stroef
Overall: Redelijk lekker donker biertje
Bottle, 330 ml, courtesy of and shared with JFK10000. Pours brown, off white head. Caramel, malty, some dried fruit, hint of spices. Light and quite drinkable, not too complex. OK.

Brown beer with a bubbly off-white head. Sour, spicy aroma of yeast and fruit. The initial flavour is tangy fruit (raisins, theres a Christmas cake-y quality to it), theres a bready yeast taste too. Sharp and lively in the mouth. Really good.
Donker roodbruin bier met veel schuim. Smaak is licht zoet en krachtig, chocolade, karamel en nootachtig met iets van kersen.
Dark brown, big white head. Aroma: yeast, nuts, caramel, spices and cherries. Taste is lightly sweet, spicy, very smooth, some roasted and caramel notes.

Dark brown beer with a good white head.
Tastes like chestnut, fruity, raisins, some sugar  and quite spicy.
Spicy finishes with a light bitterness.

Bottle. Hazy deep brown colour, big off-white head. Excellent retention. Complex and rich aroma and flavour. Fruity berry notes dominate the aroma, dried fruits, bready toasty. Taste is also complex, with lots of maltiness, bready, toasty, also high fruity esters and light sourish twang. Full body and light high carbonation. Tasty, very good and at drinkable strength.

Grabbed this bad boy in Munich. FEEL THE BERN-ardus! Mostly clear chestnut brown color with a small light beige head. The aroma is rich dark fruits - sugar plums, dates, raisins - quite nice. The flavor is also very complex, medium sweet, with loads of overripe dark fruit notes. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Quite enjoyable.
Bottle. Caramel, plums, wafers, notes of overripe fruit, minor traces of coffee and earth. Subtle, darkmalty beer, Sweetish, biterish, ok.

33 cl bottle @ my sisters. First time in many years, but I had this often enough way back when. Deep brown color. Big light beige head with uneven bubbles. Aromas: grain, light hoppy, herbs. Retronasal its fruity, yeast, spices, light hoppy. Flavor is light to moderate sweet, light spices. Medium bodied. Finishes herbal spicy, with a light bitterness.
Bottle from Wittich web shop. Sweet candy, very lively bubbly carbonation as a dubbel should be. Silken smooth texture, very soft. Nice.
33 cl julkalendern från boxbeers.dk. Rent seriöst så smakar denna bara diskmedel och lite honung. Skitöl enligt mig!

Deep brown ruby body, medium beige head. Aroma of yeast, sulfur, dried fruits, caramel. Flavours of caramel, spicies, yeast, dried fruits. Medium sweet caramel bitter finish. A bit thin, quite sessionable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark brown colored, red hue, small beige head, not too lasting. Aroma is of brown sugar, toffee, some dark fruits, yeast. Taste is medium+ sweet brown sugar, toffee, dried fruits, some honey notes, yeast, light spice, bit herbal, medium- bitterness. Medium bodied, lively carbonation, bit creamy. A bit overcarbonated.

Rossa scura/marrone, molto frizzante, torbida con molto fondo.
Odore cereali, malto, caramello, frutta matura.
Sapore dolce, caramellato, fruttato, non stucchevole nonostante il luppolo sia decisamente in secondo piano. Onesta dubbel.
Bottle. Pours a brown color with white head. Malty, fruity, caramel, slight chestnut aromas. Malty, slight toffee, caramel, plum flavors. Not too powerful of flavor, drinks good.
Rather light and thin for a dubbel at 6.7%. Pleasant and smooth, slight spice and bitterness, slightly sweet, but overall rather indistinguishable

Appearance: Light chestnut brown, clear. Good amount of fizzy light tan head.
Aroma: Spices, slight sweetness. Fruits. Raisins?
Taste: Quite sweet, fruit, light malt, spices. Nice, but bit on the light side.
Bought: Saveur-Biere.com, 330 ml, 2.00
Info: 19/2-2016, BB: 6/11-2016

Aroma: fruity, tangerine, peach, spicy, some grass
Taste: medium sweet, light bitter, honey, fruity, herbal, earthy, alcohol

Bottle 0,33L. Clear, chestnut red color with large, creamy, light brown head. Aroma of malt, caramel, vanilla and a touch of Belgian yeasts. Taste starts light sweet and fruity for the moment, than turns light bitter. Slightly tart and vinous, but still easy to drink. Medium to full body, creamy texture and soft carbonation makes it very smooth.

Average frothy off-white head with good retention. Hazy brown amber colour. Aroma is prune, spicy, Belgium yeast and bitter-acid caramel. Taste is not as complex as expected: dry and spicy with a short and dry after-taste.
Dit is een zeer mooi donker bier met medium schuimkraag. Goede stevige smaak die redelijk lang blijft hangen.

Bottle. A hazy, golden, nutty brown with a really nice frothy, bubbly head. Sediment on the bottom. Aroma was malty sweet with hints of very light spice and dried fruits. Taste is slightly sweet up front but full of very subtle but yet complex favors. Hints of fruit cake with well balanced finish.

From a 12 oz bottle into a St Bernardus chalice. Pours cloudy brown with pronounced big and little bubble head and lace. Aroma of rich brown malts, caramel, fresh baked bran muffins. Significant carbonation and mouthfeel. Flavors of rich malts, minerals, grains, slight sour mash, funky fruit rind, field herbs. It helps if this beer opens up a bit. Overall a flavorful, slightly challenging and complex beer from St Bernardus.
Bottle - pours brown with small beige head. Aroma is sugar, Apples and cereal malt. Taste is sweet with a bit of spice up front, then a lingering burnt sugar finish. Palate is very fizzy.
Brownish with an off white bubbly head, yeast, malt, raisin. A very good one.

Bottle 330ml. Cloudy brownish-copper with big frothy beige head. Yeasty aroma with notes of fruity yogurt and dried fruits, bready. Sweet flavor, yeasty with notes of yogurt, dried fruits and bread, sourish lemony finish, slightly boozy. Medium to full-bodied. Nice.

Fles uit St. Bernardus bierpakket, gekregen voor mijn verjaardag. Uitgeschonken in de bijbehorende originele Sint Bernadus bokaal. Enigszins troebel donkerbruin bier, met een vrij kleine beige schuimkraag, die zich terugtrekt. Aromas van; karamel, toffee, rozijnen, lichte chocolade, zwarte peper, kruidnagel en nootachtige accenten met een licht zuurtje. Het smaakpallet is vrij zoet en vol van karamel, vruchtencake en donker fruit, rozijnen, pruimen en vijgen. Verder wat tonen van chocolade, en een licht zuurtje, Belgische gist met een licht kruidige afdronk van peper. Stevige carbonatie en medium body, volle en complexe smaak, het alcoholpercentage lijkt hoger dan het is. Een uitstekende Dubbel, een voorbeeld in zijn stijl deze Pater 6. St. Bernardus maakt uitstekende klassieke Belgische bieren, gebalanceerd en smaakvol. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Great example of the style, with the yeast and dark malts interacting to give plenty of flavour. I get raisin, some clove, light soy and fruit cake. Dark wood colour, thin off-white head. Body is medium full and creamy. Very good.
Nice dark color. Alcoholic Roma the first taste was astounding. The love affair didnt last a little bit bitter with a bitter aftertaste, slight malt flavor somewhat busy on the tongue

Poured from a bottle. Dark maroon color, full frothy off white head. Light dusty clove and raisin aroma. Light body with a sweet malty flavor and a medium finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A light dusky aroma of clove, and raisins. Pours a cloudy brown with a lasting foamy tan head. A light raisin taste, slightly sweet taste with a medium body. A sweet fruity finish.
Looks just like a cola. Quite carbonated. Taste is a bit excessively sweet. A bit spicy.
Lovely fruity, caramel and yeast nose on this rich brown brew. Mild bitter note with sweet caramel malts, bready yeast, and dried fruit. Thats it. Its good. Back to drinking it.

Gorgeous dark colour. Loving the glass too. Bulbous ;) smells like a really honey flavoured drink. Nice memories

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle. Clear dark copper body, medium beige head, medium retention, no lacing. Strongly yeasty aroma: dough, caramel, raisins, figs. Taste of raisins, sour cherries, yeast, plums, mildly spicy. Intense carbonation. Very good.
UPDATED: OCT 30, 2016 Looks alright darker with a fluffy head across the top. A little nitter at first, nut mostly light watery malts. Odd off sour bready aftertaste. Not very good.

Wow. Part of St. Bernardus gift pack. Pours a dark chestnut. Nice head. Aroma of grass. Smooth palate. Nutty? Long finish. Really nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
33 cl bottle. Hazy brown. Floral, honey, chestnuts. Medium sweet with a drier finish. Medium carbonation, oily.

33cl bottle, served in a St. Bernardus chalice glass.
Poured a deep chestnut brown with a quickly diminishing creamy white one finger head.
Aromas of flowers, hops, herbs, earth, lemon, nutmeg, cask wood.
Moderate bittersweet flavors of spices, cask wood, hops, lemon. Medium body.
The finish is acidic and bitter and very dry. Not a brew that I enjoyed drinking and definitely not on a par with his big brother, the Abt 12 which was dilicious.
Origin: Bottle. Vessel: Snifter. Supplier: The Steam Crane (Bristol). Nose is fresh grass. Pours a opaque brown. Woody and earthy with nutty overtones. Light body.

330 ml bottle from LCBO (part of St Bernardus Mixed Pack). Pours a murky orangey brown with large, lasting light khaki coloured head. Aroma is rich dark fruit, both dried and juicy, caramel, bread and mellow spice. Flavour is raisin, plum, cherry, caramel, some breadiness and a subtle spiciness. Fine, fairly lively carbonation. Nice one.

On Tap. @ Cervecería Vincer, Gijón. 04/12/2015.
Color marron oscuro, aromas dulces, caramelo, toques a pasas.

330ml bottle. Cloudy and very dark brown colour with a small off-white head. Aroma of dried fruits, caramel, faint smell of alcohol but well hidden. Flavour is very pleasantly malty, sweet, mild spice/yeast too, dried fruits. Very nice overall.

Bottle from The Bottle Lab, Leek. Pours a hazy brown colour with a thin off white head. Aroma of bread, some caramel, slight raisin, maybe cherry, a little brown sugar and subtle spiciness. Taste of bread, caramel, some raisin, a little brown sugar, pepper plus subtle liquorice and spiciness. Medium bodied and lively carbonation. A sweetish, bready, spicy bitterness in the finish. St bernardus are a great Trappist brewery and this has nice bready malt and spiciness to it but this is quite average for a dubbel. Ok.
Cremig zacht, zoet maar niet té zoet, verfijnd gebrande smaken en zurig gist. Erg lekker! Backlog from 2014/12/22.

Aroma: fruits, malt
Taste of malt, citrus, cherries
Bittersweet aftertaste

Clowdy brwon beer, retentive tan head, spotty lacing. Nose is spicy, metallic hints and caramel, dried fruit, nuttiness. Flavor is spicy, hoppier than expected, nutty, malty. Caramel and hops in the finish. Nicenspicy.

Lukt: Malt, frukter, anelse honning.
Utseende: Brun.
Skum/kullsyre: Dekkende skum, heng langs kant.
Smak: Fruktig, noe sprudlende i munnen.

Bottle - brown with thick frothy tan head. Malty aroma, slight banana. Creamy feel, smooth, full tasting - very nice beer.

Tonaca di frate chiara con riflessi giallastri, opalescente, schiuma beige poco persistente.
Aroma di pera e banana matura, caramello, note oleose, erbacee e tostate, leggero "piccante" etilico.
Al palato sempre pera e banana matura, caramello, oleosa, erbacea, con una coda tostata ed erbacea.
Corpo medio, poco carbonata, leggermente oleosa.

From 33cl bottle, poured into trappist glass

Aroma: sweet, caramel, flora, licorice, vanilla

Appearance: brown, clear, tan head

Taste: heavy sweet, light bitter

Palate: medium to full body, creamy texture, average carbonation,

Overall: A great dubbel. This is pretty much what I expect when I order a dubbel. Great taste with loads of dark Belgian beer flavors and aromas. Some caramel and other spices in the taste. Heavy sweetness but not cloying.

F: huge, off-white, lasting.
C: dark reddish, to dark brown.
A: malty, with some grassy tones, yeast.
T: malt, some fruits, quite bitterness grassy on the palate, some chocolate tones, medium body, average carbo, some nuts and bready, very good not special.

33cl bottle part of taster pack. 6,7% Alc./Vol. Pours a murky watery brown colour witg one finger of lasting head. Complex aroma with notes of Figs, apples and cherries. The typical belgian abbey ale taste is definitely there. Lively carbonation. Lets just call it St. BERNARDUS Abt. 12 LIGHT.
Bottle@ deTolly, Tartu. Pours brown with medium size firm head. Aroma is bready, lot of hay, banana, berries, malty. Taste is sweetish, malty, slight roast,, rye bread,Medium body. Bready finish. Ok.
(bottle) clear, bright amber colour with a tall, beige head; aroma of bread, spices; balanced flavour with a long, light bitter finish; smooth palate

Couleur noire, légère mousse beige. Nez levuré, note fruitée et caramel cuit. Gout fruité, bonne levure et malt noir, pain avec épices en fin de bouche. Corps bien onctueux. Fin levuré douce, caramel cuit et épices
Very dark. Mildly sour aroma. Sour in taste with rather bitter aftertaste. Some fruity notes.

Aroma of malt, herbs, fruits and a bit caramel. Slight hazy brown appearance, white long lasting head. Medium sweetness, light bitterness; not lasting very long. Medium body, a bit creamy texture. A successful and good dubbel!
Denne St. Bernardus Pater nr. 6 har et lidt uklart udseende og et medium hvidt skum. Øllen har en både sød frugt og lidt sur aroma og smag, samt en bitter afrunding. Medium karbonering.
Bottle. Clear reddish brown with a lasting tan head. It has a malty aroma with flavors of caramel, toffee, and some nuttiness. The finish is a little sweet. Very nice.

bottle @ Party Town / Florence KY --- Cloudy brown color, solid 1/2" beige head, sheets of lace. Big aroma of caramel and fresh grain. Taste is rich malt and toffee that rides the sweet grain through a solid carbonated swallow to a finish that features just enough bittering to keep everything in check. A solid, traditional European Abbey Dubbel with a lot of sweet malt flavor and a light feel in the stomach. Recommended.
Dunkel mørk brun farve med lys beige skum. Lukt av karamell, malt, frukt og bær. Smak av karamell, malt, frukt og bær. Lett bitter ettersmak. Import.
Bottle 33 cl. Brown with good creamy foam. Aroma: combines toffee, caramel, dried fruit and cherries. Taste: sweet, caramel, yeast, toffee, very good.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2016

Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, bread, Belgian yeast, dark fruit and spices.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque dark orange/brown beer with heavy yeast and with a medium/large beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, Belgian yeast and dark fruit; ends slightly dry with bread and spices.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Super strong flavour for the abv and extremely likeable.

0.33 l bottle from Slijterij DAmstelhoek, best before 3/3/2017. Clear, reddish amber with a huge, foamy, stable, tan head. Sweetish-malty aroma of toffee, nuts and cane sugar with hints of raisins. Sweetish-malty taste of honey, toffee, nuts and cane sugar, followed by a short, slightly bitter finish. Medium to full body, very effervescent mouthfeel, lively carbonation. Very pleasant beer but a bit over-carbonated and quite one-dimensional regarding the taste. At least the rather hoppy finish balances the sweetness.

Pours dark, cloudy brown with a stable, lasting off-white head. Beautiful lacing. Aroma of toffee, caramel, nuts, dark fruits, yeast and spices. Autumn-like with a vinous undertone. Well-brewed aroma. Taste is smoothly sweet with a soft notes of caramel, dark fruits, yeast and spices. Soft, in this sense, that they remain a bit flat. Bitterish towards the end, slightly dryish in the aftertaste, but a nutty sweetness lingers long. Creamy texture, light bodied and a bit too carbonated. Well-crafted brew with a great aroma, yet a bit unbalanced and tastewise a bit too bland and lacking in complexity for a Bernardus. All in all, still a great little brother within the Bernardus family.

Reddish to brown pour with a single finger head. Lots of fruit esters and yeast on the aroma. Medium bodied. Taste has some banana as well as hints of grain. Lots of fruit. Really easy drinking for a dubbel.
@ Agards väg 5/9-15. Bottle from local kiosk, Brussels. Dried fruity with spices and some malt. Body is medium, dry finish.
Tasting @ Gaultier 150905. Bottle (750 ml) from local supermarket, Brussels. Malty and fruity with nutty notes and dried fruits, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry and fruity.
Tasting @ gaultier. Bottle from local kiosk in brussels. Dried fruit, banana and almonde in both aroma and taste. Dry finish

Color marrone castagno; schiuma abbondante, cremosa e persistente. Aroma fruttato e speziato, deciso e ricco: ci senti il pepe, la cannella, le nocciole e il fruttato leggermente asprigno di frutta rossa, insieme alla banana e alla frutta bianca. Il corpo è snello, scattante, aiutato da una frizzantezza pronunciata: ci ritrovi tutto il naso, arricchito da un amarino granuloso di malto tostato e un sottile mix di liquirizia/caffè. Finisce ricca, vivace e curiosa, con un retrogusto piccante di spezie.
In bottiglia. Aroma di nocciola, frutta secca, cioccolato. Al palato corpo medio, con sentori di frutta secco, leggero lievito, caramello, cioccolato.

Clear red copper, brown head
Toffee, caramel, raisins, passito
Balanced
aftertaste mou candy
riped fruit, bitterness due to yeasts (?), milk chocolate
Aroma is plum alcohol, huge head that dissipates quickly, OK lacing, taste is surprising - almost like a coffee stout with some metal.

0.33 bottle from Pivoljub, Ljubljana, Slovenia. Hazy reddish brown, turns hazy orange on the light. Creamy off-white to beige head. Caramel and dried fruits, fruit jam, cake. Cherry sourness, red fruits, light sweetness, alcohol presence. Quite sour finish, soft carbonation. Id love to have another.
how you can not like this beer is beyond me. toasty, nutty, meaty and satisfying. a medium body keeps it approachable

Bottiglia da 33 cl. Color leggero ambrato con schiuma nocciola di grana media di media tenuta. I profumi dono fruttati di frutta a polpa gialla matura e nocciole. Al palato inizio fruttato che lascia spazio a sentoti di spezie e un finale amarognolo, corpo medio che fa sentire un pó troppo lalcool.

Bottle from Beergium. Dark brown color, beige head. Bitter taste with citrus, toffee, nuts, earthy notes, ripe fruits and a bit of yeast. Bitter finish with citrus, toffee, earthy notes and yeast. Very nice, smooth abbey dubbel.

Yeasty, malty, lots of Basement aromas, earthy, grassy, bready malts, ruby colour, medium off-white head, lacing. Soft bite, noticably sweet, lightly salty. Medium body, lively carbonation, yeasty finish. 
Solid.
Bottle. Dark brown, small head. Aroma of caramel, banana, spices. In taste banana, caramel, candi syrup, spices. Dry and medium bitter in the finish. Very light dubbel, a bit boring, still ok.
Brown hazy pour, some yeast inside. Clove and spice aroma with some brown malts. Some sweet dark fruits and nice brown malt balance.
faint smell though that could be my cold appearance dark ruby thin layer of foam taste dark malts caramel. hint of red. fruit but not to much pretty bitter nicely balanced good beer

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty dark fruit aroma. Fruity malty spicy yeasty dark fruit and caramel flavor. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty caramel dark fruit finish.

Pours a murky chestnut brown with fluffy off-white head that reduces quickly to a thin skim.
Nose is sweet malt with prominent cola note combined with fruitiness, not so much a cherry coke as a raisin coke. That follows on the palate, along with nut and honey flavors. 
Theres a pronounced spritz and a full, somewhat slick mouthfeel, with slight bitterness on the finish.
Not as complex as some of its siblings, but a fine drink.

Acobreada,levemente opaca,espuma abundante e duradoura;aroma se desprende fácil aparecendo um frescor cítrico acompanhado de notas herbáceas e condimentadas,álcool já notado; sabor inicial adocicado aparecendo malte,frutas secas e vermelhas,ameixa,leve picante finaliza dando um equilíbrio impar e harmônico,álcool presente bem inserido,corpo médio/alto,boa carbonatação. Boa trapista,equilibrada,saborosa,encorpada,referência para o estilo,degustação obrigatória a todos apreciadores de uma boa cerveja

Cloudy dark amber brown colour, small white head. Aroma of dried fruits and spices, hint of wine. Dry and lightly sweet taste has same notes plus caramel malt and hops in dry finish and aftertaste. Medium body and fizzy carbonation. Interesting dubbel, unusually dry.

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2015 Delft 21-11-2015

Lekker bruin, zoet bier met een caramel achtige smaak. Schuimkraag verdwijnt snel. Heel licht bitter. Prettige smaak maar iets minder dan de overige St Bernardus bieren.

Pours a nice dark brown color with a few floaties in it with a good head. Aroma is malty, nutty, toffee, figs, vinous cherry, almonds, toasty. Taste is aggressive malt, nuts, and figs with a background of toffee and toasted almonds. Very good dubbel, very carbonated on the mouthfeel as well for a 6.7% beer, definitely a solid example of the style.
Aroma is toasted malt, caramel and sweet. The taste is somewhat crisp and bitter, the alcohol does show. Nice colour with a decent head. Its a good beer overall.

Precioso color a caramelo. Espuma escasa que desaparece pronto dejando una capa de nata. Aroma a caramelo y fruta. Buen cuerpo. Carácter general especiado, adornado con caramelo, algo de chocolate, frutas rojas... Excelente
Bottle.Muddy brown colour with medium head.Aroma of caramel and nuts,good full body and hint of ripped banana and vanilla nice well balanced and toasted finish.
the aroma is caramel. fruity and nutty with notes of toffee and vanilla... the taste is caramel with notes of nuts, dark fruits. fig, toffee and some spices... aftertaste is sweet, dry and spicy...

Appearance is a murky, dark ruby/brown, a one finger lasting off-white head. Aroma- cherry, lots of malt, sweet raisin and sultana, yeast, marzipan, almonds, vinous undertones. Taste- vinous, cherry sweetness, sugary raisin, hint of banana,nutty and slightly bittersweet finish. Fluffy mouthfeel. Nice stuff.

Bottle. Pours a murky reddish brown with a thin mostly lasting bubbly head. Aroma of apples, caramel, nutty, spice. Taste is of caramel, apple, pear, fig, slightly bitter finish. Medium to high carbonation, light bubbly mouthfeel.

Gutes Abtei Dubbel

die vielen geschmacksnoten stechen nicht so hervor,wie ichs mir erhofft habe
Bottle at home Brown with dense white head. Aroma and taste of Yeast, dark. Palate medium body, sticky, lively. FInish is bit bitter and fresh.

Aroma has some sweet apples, malts and nuts. Pours dark amber with a white head. Taste is very sweet with malts and fruits, and a little acidic. Sticky palate, lingers in your mouth. Overall a decent beer, though it doesnt taste very much.

33cl bottle, hazy brown color, creamy persistent brownish head, caramel and raisins aroma, spices, banana and yeast notes, sweet flavor, medium body, finish with spices and sweet caramel aftertaste, very nice (dolciona belga leggera ma pompatissima)

Big bottle from total wine and spirits with commonmac and rosskyle. Cloudy plum Color with off white head. Sour dark fruit aroma with funkiness. Yeast, dark fruit, slight Belgian yeast and sourness, and fuzzy finish. Fills out their portfolio well even if its not as great as the 8, 10, 12.

Bottle purchased at Total Wine & Spirits. Poured into Belgian glass. Aroma is kind of a cola, plum/dark fruit. Its a murky, mahogany/brown color with tan head. Little bit of a funky, yeast or borderline sour quality. Nice round mouthfeel that almost has a velvety characteristic. Malty with dark fruit at the finish. Pretty solid but others in the St. Bernardus family are better.

Served out of a bottle at Mac's house. Dark red color with medium white head. Sweet plum aroma. Medium to light body. Raisin plum sweet flavor but weaker than other St. Bernardus beers. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cor marrom clara, turva. Espuma boa, bege e cremosa. Aroma de caramelo, fermento e alcoólico. Paladar levemente alcoólico, caramelo, toffee e ameixa preta. Vivaz. Um verdadeiro espetáculo!!!!
Plums, stone fruit, with some spice. Clean and a bit thin but classic dubbel. Beautiful malt character.

Pours a dark chestnut brown initially with big foamy tan head which quickly goes. Aroma is initially a noticable cola type smell followed by berry type fruits and figs, doughy yeast and cereal malt with a slight herbal presence. Taste is initially sweet then sour and bitter, nicely balanced. Lively carbonation and slick feel. Very nice Abbey Dubbel beer!
Bottle. Hazy amber color with a frothy head. Aroma of yeast, almond and caramel. Slightly bitter taste. Silky feel. Medium body.

33cl bottle at home. A mild, even light and good to drink Belgian dubbel. It is a bit of a minor beer in the St. Bernardus series. Yet as a dubbel, a very lovely drink with well balanced sweet bitterness flavours - and of course with the so typical chestnut scents and brown sugar notes.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka, warka do 08-04-16. Bardzo bujna, wysoka, ladna i dosc powoli opadajaca piana, lekko kremowa. samo piwo miedziano-brazowe, lekko metne. Aromaty ciemnych owocow, w tym glownie suszonych (rodzynki), slodowe, lekka przyprawowosc, troche alkoholu, troche karmelu Jednym slowem: dublowo ;) w smaku wiekszosc nut z aromatu jest odczuwalnych (moze poza przyprawami), lekko w slodka strone w miodowy sposob, z deikatnym szczypaniem nieniskiego wysycenia.goryczki wlasciwie brak, jednak "w zamian" czuc troche alkoholu - w nieirytujacy sposob. Niemalo ciala. Bardzo gladkie, kremowe w odczuciu. wyjatkowo "lekkie" w piciu. bardzo dobre piwo, najwyzsza polka dubbli. z 8mka z tego browaru przegrywa w kategorii intensywnosci, zwlaszcza owocowej, ale wygrywa wlasnie ta lekkoscia, pijalnoscia.Update a propos food-pairing - zupelnie nie pasuje do camamberta - w polaczeniu z nim staje sie kwasne :)Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
Nez sur le pain de segle, corps moyen, amertume présente, on sent bien le sucre candi, une belge qui a du charme!

330 mL bottle from Total Wine, Virginia Beach, VA. Murky brown pour with a foamy off-white head. Aroma of Belgian yeast and light cola. Nice flavor of dark fruit, candi sugar, and light chocolate. A very easy to drink Belgian dubbel.

Reddish brown colour with tiny white head. Aroma of malts, dried fruits, Fruits, especialy plums, little banana. The same is flavour, with low carbonation and bitterness. Sweet, friuty aftertaste with little alcoholic presence.

Sampled from a bomber at the Big Texas Beer Fest. Poured a translucent brown with a beige head. Taste of biscuit, caramel malts and Belgian yeast spice. Highly lively carbonation, medium slick body. Well balanced
Flaska från Saveur Biére. Smak och doft av humle, malt, karamell, belgisk jäst med toner av torkad frukt och brunt socker. Lagom sötma, lätt kropp, fruktig med fin beska.
The bottle may look a little childish, but the beer inside is definitely not!

Bottle - very big foamy head, dark copper color, Belg yeast spice and complexity, dark fruity notes, pretty good overall 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

NOTA DE CATA: 
- Color: St. Bernardus Pater 6 presenta un color marrón oscuro. 
- Olor: Agradable aroma a pasas, malta y chocolate. 
- Sabor: Sabor de la malta, ron, ciruelas, moras, levadura y chocolate belga.

0.33 bottle. Dark, hazy, brown color and a small, tanned head. Aroma of dark malts, spices, dark fruits, and dough. Taste is sweet, malty, buttery, spicy, a tad alcoholic. Medium body, slick texture, and soft carbonation. Finish is medium long and relatively well balanced with a lot of buttery notes. Overall a standard bruin.
deep brown with a robust creamy head. cola aroma. somewhat sour with a little vanilla and some sweetness. not as good last he abt 12 or their Christmas Ale, but still a decent beer
11.2 oz bottle. Deep brown, almost opaque with particulates and carbonation all week. Sugary nose, slightly sweet. Taste is slight bitter to mild sweet and a hint of aftertaste. Pure win.
Bottle: Aroma is sourly-sweet with fruity with notes of sourly plums, malt, caramel. Flavor is malty, fruity, sourly-sweet.
21.6.2014. Hazy brown. Not much aroma with flu, some malts and caramel. Malty taste with slight caramel, spices, dark fruits. There are better dubbels.

Bottle @ Koht, Tallinn.
Amber color, small head. Bread, belgian yeast aroma. Very good.
Intense chestnut brown, small head. Yeasty bread-like aroma. Malty notes. Full aroma, dark bread, a bit sweet but developing a full and bitter taste. Quite rich for only 6,7 % alc.
This is a nice dubbel. Fairy light on the tongue in the typical Belgian way, but flavorful. Some caramel, maybe raisins, botanical yeast. Not a blockbuster like the bigger StBs.

2015/03/03 - Pours a hazy brown-amber colour with a soapy, khaki head that quickly reduces to a film. Aroma is yeast, mild banana, doughy notes, caramel, raisin, dates, figs and herbal hops. Taste starts doughy yeast and mild banana, shifts to dark fruits (raisins, dates, figs) and caramel and finishes with mildly bitter, herbal hops. A nice "lighter" beer from St. Bernie. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle from a sample pack. Pours darker than the 12, 8 or tripel. Almost no head. Aroma has very slight notes of spice must. Taste is smooth. No hint at all of the ABV. Maybe the best of the St. Bernardus beers.

Dark reddish brown beer, cloudy, with white head.
Aroma: Sharp aroma of belgian yeasts, some basement/barnyard, spices, than fruity-wine aromas. 
Taste: Mainly sour. Flavors same as in aroma: spice herbs, wine.
Body: medium, short, sour finish.
Really nice Belgian Dubbel. Definitly what Im expecting in this style.

Pours a nice dark ruby red with a small head. On the nose i get banana, and the beer also has nice yeasty and bready character. Flavor is quite good and complex with flavors of caramel, dusty leather, candi syrup with a quite nice carbonated mouthfeel. Beer has a quite dry finish and is nicely balanced.

As if I could not love a St. Bernardus brew! Even though this brewski kicks it pretty dang hard, shes still not quite in a lofty "loved it" category. A cloudy, barnyard-mud brown with an incredibly frothy beige head pours from the monk-adorned bottle. Earthy fall leaves, leather, brown sugar, raisins, basement and spicy herbal hops are exuded from my glass. The taste matches nicely, a bright carbonation and dry feel tickle the tongue. There just isnt as much flavour as I was hoping for. Still delicious though.

Small head, plenty of sediment, almost nontransparent. Taste is pretty odd (maybe it applies to the specific bottle I had) and reminds me homebrew: a little of yeast, of alcohol, a lot of wine. Not bad, not really good either.
I could definitely get the caramel aroma from this. Fitting as the colour of the beer also reminds me of caramel. Great drink!
Brown color wih big head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is spicy and a bit of a tart fruit. Taste is malty, but not too sweet, more spices. Complex and just Bernardus quality!

Bottle. Dark brown colour with a light brown head. Aroma has yeast, coffee, sour elements and malt. Taste is malty with a bit sour and somewhat bitter aftertaste. Earthy flavors with malt, yeast, spices and some banana.
33 cl. bottle @home. Dark brown beer, cant make much of the aroma. Taste and palate are very good, very well balanced beer.
Dark color with caramel head. Lots of malt flavor. Bready aroma and a strong mouthfeel.

bottle. Pours slightly hazy ruby-brown, large head. Raisins, bread and caramel malts, yeast. Its not the most complex beer, but it gets extra points for having good balance and not being overwhelmingly sweet.

Draft at Churchkey. Im actually shocked, SHOCKED I hadnt had this one before. This isnt a case of just not rating it after drinking it, I mean, I havent had it before. Anyway... this may now be what I consider the easily available benchmark Belgian Dubbel. Solid from start to finish. well rounded. Actually amazing i have never had this before. Smooth malty notes, well rounded dark fruits, yeast combine and create a wonderful beverage here. Highly drinkable.

The smallest of the series of dark Sint-Bernardus abbey beer and the historical counterpart of Westvleteren 6 Special, which itself was replaced by the Blond in 1998. This Sint-Bernardus version has the same basic yeastiness as its bigger brethren; bronze colour paler than Prior or Abt, creamy pale beige head; caramelly, with restrained but pleasant and well-balanced fruitiness, hint of iron but not feeling industrial, subdued sweetish onset, dried fruits, notably thinner mouthfeel than the Prior or the Abt, caramelly, yeasty, with a good herbal hop bitterish balance. Very enjoyable dubbel.

First beer I tried out of the St Bernardus Holiday Mixer Pack.

Smells like a Wheat Beer. Pours a very dark caramel colour with a good amount of head. Taste is very similar to Erdinger Dunkel Weisbrau. Lots of carbonation due to bottle fermentation.

Overall very impressed with this beer. Wish I could buy it all year round.

MB

330 ml bottle. Pours a dark brown with light white head. Aromas of bready malts, light spice, and raisins. Flavors are similar with emphasis on big malts. Somewhat sweet but lighter than the 8 and 12.

330 ml bottle. Pours cloudy caramel brown, impressively steady head, light beige. Aroma of sweet pear, toasted malt, ginger bread, some banana and caramel. Nice bouquet given the alcohol%. Light to medium mouthfeel, sweet, a tad spicy, medium dry finish. Taste is a bit on the bland side but nice and decent overall.

Pours a deep opaque brown with a cream head that lingers and leaves lacing. The nose is slightly malt. The taste is caramel with nuttiness. The body is thinner than expected. 11.2 oz bottle in a variety pack with a best by date of 7/27/15.

330 ml / 33 cl, flaske, 6,7 % ABV, købt i Den Belgiske Ølbutik i Vanløse, 23. januar 2015.
Kastanjebrun ufiltreret Abbey Dubbel med 6 cm tyk offwhite skumtop, som svinder til skumlandskab indenfor en halv snes minutter.
I næsen er lidt fjern mørk frugt, såsom rosin. Oveni lidt kælder-aroma. 
Udmærket smag som er præget af sødme. Derudover en let skjult syrlighed, som stikker momentvis frem. Sammenholdt med en medium bitterhed giver det en ganske habil Dubbel med et pænt alkoholindhold, man sagtens fornemmer.
Medium karbonering, som har godt af at foretage sig og en olieret konsistens. Bittersød eftersmag i en øl med medium krop. 
Stærk Dubbel med lille ekstra bitter smag.
Poured medium dark brown with a full finger tan head. Active carbonation. Grassy aroma. Nice lacing. Nutty flavour. A bit of bitterness on the finish. Not bad.

Pours a brown color with a light white foam head. Aroma is raisin, caramel, some nut, and a touch of Belgian yeast. The flavors come out very muted, with the nutty finish the most prominent. Underwhelming.

Bottle, 0.33l. Cloudy muddy brown color with small frothy off-white head and sparkling appearance. Aroma of yeast, dark fruits, wheat, dust and some alcohol. Taste starts with moderate sweet caramel, following is grassy, papery and moderate alcoholic, mouthfeel is spicy, while finish is mild bitter. Light to medium body, slick texture and lively carbonation in palate. Not fascinating, will surely need to re-rate it...

Pours a dark hazy amber with a foamy off white head. Aromas of Belgian yeast, berries, raisin, and some floral notes. Has a medium body with a rather fizzy carbonation. There is a light sweetness on the tongue that evolves into a dry bitterness. Pretty good beer, but not my favorite from St. Bernardus.
Pours slight brown gold with a slight carbonation although disappears quickly. Aroma is caramel sweetness and light hop. Taste is light sweet caramel, grains and a slight nuttiness.

Bottiglia 33cl comprata da giangaspero e bevuta a casa.
Marroncina con schiuma eterna.
Caramello, corpo leggerino carbonazione leggera.
Finale amaro

33cl in St. Bernardus glass. Pours quite an abundant, slighlty beige, frothy head; very dark amber to chestnut colour, some ruby reflexes. Smells very yeasty and bready, leathery, clove, unmistakably belgian. Tastes caramel, dried fruits, vanilla, sweet spiced; moderate sweetness on this one, and extremly subtle bitterness; some light tart/acidic notes. Lively carbonation, medium + body, creamy and fizzy texture. Super-balanced, extremly clean malty finish, very smooth and drinkable, typical St. Bernardus aftertatste

Has a sour apple like aroma with a mild earthy background. Super fluffy white head on top of a deep ruby red body. Lots of sediment floating around. Has a nice warming feeling going down. Tart and apple spice taste. Dry on the finish. Enjoyable.
Bottle from LCBO. Cloudy dark copper colour. Citrus, brown sugar, Euro hops on the nose. Fruit and malty, apples. Crisp. Good stuff.
From bottle. Pours hazy dark mahogany with a thick dense beige foam head and lots of lacing. Aroma of dark fruits and candy. Taste is dark fruity with a nice sweetness. Gently hopped.

Pours a dirty brown color, topped with a fairly nice off-white head. Some caramel in the nose, fruity with some spices. Taste is slightly sweet and fruity with a decent bitterness in the end. Not bad.
Bottle. Dark brown, a bit bubbly. Nose of clove, spices. Tastes of Christmas spices, light candi sugar, some lighter fruit notes. A very good all purpose beer.

Aroma of sweet dried dark fruit, like raisin, fig, and date with a balancing oaky european hop character. Appears rubyish dark brown with plenty of off white foam and lace. Tastes very balanced between mildly sweet and slightly more bitter on the end; hay and candy sugar are the primary flavors with a hint of clementine citrus. Palate is fizzy, a little thin and a little oily.

Kettle caramelized aroma with notes raisons and plums. Appearance is a hazy brown with an off white head with good retention. Kettle caramelized flavor with notes of dark dried fruits. Mouthfeel is medium with high carbonation. Overall, it tastes good. Could use more malt complexity and some more body.

Liquide orangé sous une mousse blanche généreuse mais contenue, avec un nez de fruits confits (prunes, abricots, un peu de cerises). La bouche est assez sèche pour ce style, et pas trop intense côté saveurs, mais cela laisse poindre des malts plus céréaliers que prévu, et ce nest pas désagréable. Une dubbel plus désaltérante, plus accessible que la plupart de ses compétitrices, pour le meilleur et pour le pire. Personnellement, on apprécie loriginalité.
Pours dark maroon with a good head. Smells of apples, citrus and plums. Very creamy and smooth. Starts slightly sweet and ends in well rounded bitterness. Excellent.
Boa carbonatação. Agradável no palato. Suave para uma dubel. Apresentou um creme uniforme, mas que se desfez rapidamente. Sente-se levemente o álcool no aroma.

Dark brown opaque beer with a thin bubbly head. Some light bubbling.
Smell is caramel, apples, honey, cloves, hint of chocolate.
Fizzy warm taste, slightly oily. Good sweet bitter balance. Bit of alcoholic sourness, with some maltiness. Dry finish, bit earthy.
Bottle. Pours a reddish copper, off white head, piles of lacing. Nose is spicy, sweet malt. Tastes fresh, sweet carmalized malt, spicy. Really good.

Its really smooth throughout, starting with a scent of bread dough and raisins, a surprisingly light body and hints of sweet and sour on the finish. Liberated from a Christmas 4-pack gift box a few days before the holiday - cheers!

11.578 oz bottle poured into chalice. Great aroma of Belgian yeast and fruits. Pours a dark ruby tinted dark brown with an off white head that dissipates rapidly, but stays thin for the long haul. Very light and slightly carbonated, easy to drink. Flavors of yeast and some fruit notes with a great finish. Low abv for a Belgium makes this a go to for me.

330ml bottle from Beer Station, Xiamen. A gusher even after cooling in the fridge for a day. Pours hazy dark brown with a lot of foam that dissipates to a thin off white head. Aroma of malt, toffee and Belgian yeast. Sweet finish. Nice.

Advent Calander for December 5th. Deep chestnut brown colour, with thick off white head. Berry and fruit aroma, the taste has this too, with a touch of yeast. Very well balanced. Bitter, sweet and sour.

Draft 0.15l at St.Bernardus stand at Horeca Expo Ghent Belgium 2014.Pour it dark color with medium white head.Taste and aroma of sweet fruits, malt, Belgian yeast,maybe some caramel.All together good compact brew.Nice
330 mL bottle. Mahogany pour with a tall sandy head, lots of sticky lacing. Aroma, is yeasty, sweet, fruit. Taste of dough, sweet toffee and brown sugar. Medium carbonation, semi dry finish.

Gesztenye barna szín, cappuccino-szerű és hosszan tartó habréteg; ilyen egy vizuális téren tökéletes belga apátsági dubbel. Szinte ontja magából a pikánsan élesztős, fűszeres, almás, pirított magvas aromákat, mely összetevők mesterien elevenednek meg az első kortyok során, tejes-tejszínes, enyhén kókuszos és vaníliás, tehát messzemenőkig krémes szerkezetben. Az alkohol szinte láthatatlan, a pörkölt maláta édes alapjain felépülő karakter lebilincselően elegáns, nagyszerűen kiegyensúlyozott, megnyerő modora markáns, ugyanakkor mindenféle szerénytelenség nélküli. Pont olyan, amilyennek a típus egyik mintapéldányának lennie kell.
Bottle from variety pack from LCBO. Aroma of sweet malt. Sweet malty taste too; pretty nice. Good dubbel.

Pours deep brown with a two finger mushy moustache making cap. A really nice sipper that offers swirls of caramel & dried fruit, with a slight leafy finish. Pulled from the LCBO 6 pack sampler & its another winner.
330cc bottle. Cloudy ruby brown. Creamy persistent head. Very fruity and yeasty, fruity aroma. Nice body with a dry finish. Very good beer.
Bottle at Rotary student pub. Pours a lot of head. Aroma is mild and yeasty. Taste is also mild, yeasty and earthy. A good trappist beer,

Mahoniekleurig bier met snel zakkende schuimkraag.
Neus is moutig met kruidige toets.
Mondgevoel is vol 
Afdronk is caramelachtig met kruidig eind.
Scents of spice, yeast, and honey. Hazy mahogany colour. Flavour of dried fruit, coffee, and ginger. Medium body with lively carbonation. Really good beer.

330 mL bottle. Hazy chestnut brown with ruby highlights. Brown head recedes but never disappears. Fairly typical yeasty, fruity (plums, golden raisins) aroma. Appealing, though. Mouthfeel is drier than expected, and certainly dry for the style. Taste doesnt live up to the aroma. Good, not great.

Pours a deep Amber, aroma is malt, spice, dark fruits, hint of sugar. Taste is malt and dark fruit. Very smooth and creamy. Excellent Dubbel.

330ml bottle. Hazy mahogany with a foamy off-white head. Flavors are bread, brown sugar and dark fruits with herbal and nutty notes. Medium body, lively carbonation, thin texture.
Sötétbordó, élénk gazdag habbal. Illata furminttos, pezsg?s, édeskés és fanyar. Közepesen testes, szénsavas kesernyés ragacsos végz?déssel. Kellemes.

330ml bottle 
6.7% ABV 
Milton LCBO Outlet #2 (Milton, Ontario, Canada) 
November 13, 2014
Part of the St. Bernardus mixed pack. The beer pours a semi-translucent copper-tinged brown with a rocky off-white head. The aroma is yeast, brown sugar, plums, and roasted malts. The mouthfeel is full bodied, creamy, with above average carbonation. The flavour is sweet mal;t, caramel, raisins, yeast, and a spicy finish. A huge fan of St. Bernardus, and this is a very good beer.

Smells quite nice, if not overly complex. Light candi sugar, sweet malt, slight funk. Hazy brown, long lasting off-white head. Tastes great, like a less intense Abt 12. Upfront sweet candi sugar, finishes with cloves, red dried fruit, other spice. Not as much alcohol heat and a mild sweetness that isnt cloying makes this quite drinkable. Medium/light bodied and average carbonation. Great dubbel.
Una dubbel ben strutturata e carica. di colore scuro con buona schiuma, risulta essere non troppo beverina

330 mL bottle. Pours orange hued amber with a lumpy thick head of off white. Moderate clarity; very attractive. Fruity on the nose with apple, pear, some fig, sweet grainy malt with toffee and toast character. Nice yeasty spice, earth and orange inflections. Nicely dry, balancing its complex maltiness, subtle hop bittering. Finshes quite clean. Smooth, moderate body and full carbonation. Very good indeed.
Bottle. Dark brown color with offwhite head. Aroma - Malts, sugar. Nutty taste with some fruits.

330ml bottle from the st bernardus mixed 6er @ the LCBO. Very solid dubble. I really love the lower gravity dark Belgian ales. Not that I dont love a nice quad but this beer I could sit down and have a few of. Great beer.
Sweet and fruity to start, tartly bitter on the finish. A little on the thin side, especially at the end, and not as well rounded as the big guys of the style.
Bottle. Pours Brown / cola coloured beer. Sweet, sour beery smell. Taste is really balanced between sour, sweet and bitter. Great beer from a great brand!

330ml bottle from the LCBO. Transparent brown body with a doamy off-white head. I was expecting a lot more complexity on the nose, however this beer is quite simple and well-done. Wood and fig on the nose, quite sessionable. Oily watery body with a minimal hop based lingering finish. Well integrated alcohol.
Bottle at home. Pours brown color, white head. Aroma is yeasty, herbal, caramel. Taste is medium sweet, caramel, roasted malt, yeasty, herbal, spicy.

33 cl bottle at home. Pours into the correct glass with a nice tight white head. I can only describe the aroma as beefy. I made a beef stew the other day with red wine, balsamic vinegar and Worcester sauce. The aroma matches this perfectly. Rich, warming mouthfeel , dark fruit with balancing hop, leafy, resiny almost that peppermint jam that Westmalle Dubble has. Overall, excellent as one would expect from this brewery. Most folks go for the higher strength beers, but this brewery can work very well at this strength too.

Bière aux grandes qualités gustatives, la Saint Bernardus Pater 6 est désormais une référence parmi les bières belges dites "D'abbaye". Pourtant, les bières "Saint Bernardus" n'ont jamais été brassée au sein d'une abbaye et encore moins par des moines. Toutefois, leurs recettes ont elles été élaborées par les moines de l'abbaye cistercienne St. Sixtus qui produit aujourd'hui les bières trappistes Westvleteren, considérées comme les bières trappistes les meilleures mais les plus rares qui soient. La Saint Bernardus Pater 6 est une bière brune de haute fermentation qui développe dans le verre une couleur brune ainsi qu'une mousse abondante. Elle dégage des arômes maltés qui procure au nez une sensation de fruité puissante, avec en accompagnement des pointes épicés. On découvre en bouche des saveurs de malts, elles aussi très fruitées. Elles sont par contre suivi d'une amertume, relativement puissante pour une bière brune, qui révèle la présence du houblon.
Brown cloudy with medium light yellow creamy head. In taste balanced sourness, bitterness and caramel, certain fruity and sweet notes.

Immediately a perfect head, a good start! An aroma with subtile lavander and honey. Well-ballaced between sweetness and bitter. I cant stop drinking this beer, Id say its perfect, but nothing is perfect, really.
Pours caramel with a foamy white head. Aromas of caramel, raisins, figs and rye bread. Taste is very much the same. Competent, but rather unexciting.

330ml bottle poured in a chalice.
Classic Belgian Dubbel. St. Bernardus quality, no mistake.
A: Pours a nutty dark amber color. Cloudy with many particles floating around. The head is big, beige and persistent. Very aired and foamy. Few lacings left
S: Sweet on the nose. Caramel, mainly. Caramel malts, dark fruits. Strong on Belgian yeasts. Earthy hops. Reminds a brown bread somehow
T: Follows the nose, a balanced sweet-bitterness belgian style. Candy sugar, caramel malts (actually, quite malty) and raisins. A sweet upfront, bit watery and metallic mouth sensation. Biscuity too. Good bitter end. Hops are earthy. Belgian yeasts
M: Medium body and carbonation. A bit molasses. Bitter-sweet Belgian style
O: Good drinkability. Not the best St. Bernardus that Ive had but for sure a great beer
[ BA Review @ 10/31/2010 ]

0.33L bottle. Pour clear mahoganey with a huge, rocky, off-white head. Rich aroma profile: bubblegum, fruit and sweet malt, along with dusty basement aromas. Flavor is mildly sweet at first, with some bubblegum and chocolate. Surprisingly absent of flavor in the middle, finishing with a yeasty bitterness. Medium-light body with a thin mouthfeel and mild carbonation. Overall, the flavor disappoints, but aromas are really nice on this beer. Still, very drinkable.

Aroma - sweet rusty smell. Expecting something malty with the first sip. 
Appearance - poured a brownish color with a big foamy head.
