Taste - pretty pleasant taste. Sweet but with a balancing tart bitterness. A little "coppery" for my taste. 
Palate - very fizzy. 
Overall - good but a little too caramel sweet and bitter for what I was looking for.
"malty brew...maybe a hint of brown sugar? a hint of hops. nice and direct, not a ton of complexity, but pretty tasty. i liked it, but maybe not for the premium price...

Aroma speziato dolce con note di lievito e nocciole il gusto dolce caramellato con una tostatura leggera con note legnose nociole e speziate, finale asciutto, abbastanza corposa e abbastanza equilibrata

Pours a very hazy brown body with a thick head. Nice yeasty aroma. Nice creamy taste with malt tones, lacks the real punch though.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: notes of carmel, crust of dark bread, risins
Appearance: plenty of foam, small and middle bubbles very stable, beer is dark brown and cloudy, good lacing.
Taste: crust of dark bread, alcohol is good hidden, but is perceptible, notes of raisins and caramel , bitterness is low, sweetness is medium. 

Is sum:
This beer is quite ok, but its still far from good. I dont remember this beer as a something special and worth to drink again.

11.2 oz bottle with a best by this week date of 19 Sept. 2014. Allowed to warm to about 45F then served in a St. Bernardus snifter. . 

Poured cloudy dark brown into the snifter, with a sudsy, tan head that left a full coat of lacing.on the glass with each tip. 

The rich aroma is spicy, fruity (dark), yeasty and malty, with a faint hint of over-ripe banana . 

T: Complex, with a feast of flavor components culminating in a lingering aftertaste of dark fruits, dark bread and roasted grains. Suggestions of raisins, dates, prune, apple, caramel, banana, allspice and other spices. Excellent balance of sweet and bitter with a touch of sour.

M: medium-full body with lively, and medium-high carbonation. Creamy smooth after the carbonation dies down. 

O: a must-try Belgian: a rich, unique and complex dubbel meant to be slowly sipped and savored, with different nuances noticed on every sip.

Bottle from the Bierzwerg webshop. Clear deep nut golden body verging on mahogany. Light brown, dense large head. Slow gusher. Wooden rock sugar, dates, raisins and band aid on the nose. Full bodied. Sweet furniture polish, oak, rubber, malts and bitterness to balance. High carbonation. Light astringent. Dry tongue. This beer works way better for me as I swirl out most of the carbonation. As it heats it becomes more malty, balanced and full flavored and a beer I would gladly drink again.

Transfer from BA review on 6-15-13-

 Poured from bottle into a chalice glass

 Appearance- Pours an orange-copper color with a light haze and a small off white head. The head fades rather fast leaving only a light level of lace on the sides of the glass. 

 Smell- The aroma is of heaviest of a dark brown bread smell mixed with plenty of darker fruit aromas of prune, cherry and raisin. Along with these smells comes a light yeasty and caramel aroma as well.

 Taste- The taste begins with a bready and darker fruit flavor of raisin and prune. As the flavor advances some banana and yeast mixed with a bit of a caramel sweetness also enter the taste. The banana is joined by some other lighter fruits of apple and citrus as the flavor moves more toward the end lightening the taste slightly. At the end, some bitterness of a earthy hop flavor joins the taste leaving a nice somewhat crisper flavor to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel-The body of the beer is on the average side in terms of thickness and creaminess with a carbonation level that is on the average side as well. Both are appropriate for the style and act as a nice medium for the fruity and yeasty as well as lightly hoped and bready flavors of the brew.

 Overall- This brew is a quite tasty dubbel overall with a very nice flavor profile and a good drinking feel.

Nice looking cloudy dark brown color, big off-white head. Caramel, berries and raisins aroma, some brown sugar. Medium sweetness. Thin to medium body, soft to average carbonation. Sweet caramel finish. Nice.
(Pivoljub 0,33l bottle)

Hazy brown body with a medium but then diminishing off white head. Aroma is fruity, spicy, yeasty. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitterness. Light to medium body, thin to oily texture. Light astringent finish. Not the best I had from St. Bernardus but still a really good beer.

Bottle @ Home 
brown, hazy, rocky head, tan foam, caramel, cereal, basement aromas, leaves, herbs, alcohol, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, full body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish,
Solid Belgian dubbel beer. Nice malty body with some caramel. Has spices and a good bitterness.
Cloudy brown color, big off white head. Aroma of malts, sugar, yeast, raisins, blackberries. Medium sweet taste, very dry. Medium to full body, soft carbonation. Fine dubbel.
Bottle. Pour is dark with a large foamy head, aroma is dark fruits and caramel. Taste is dark fruits with caramel, soft finish, body is full with creamy texture and lively carbonation. Nice

Pours a dark mahogany with a yellowish head quick to dissipate. Smells of tart and sour cherries, chestnuts. Crisp carbonation and light bodied. Complex but yet very solid easy drinking Belgian ale. Chestnut flavored malt dominates and is balanced against lightly sour fruit like plums or cherries. The crisp, dry finish takes away that sour flavor. I could say a lot more or less, try one for sure regardless what style of beer you prefer.

Hazy, lovely mahogany pour. Golden raisin, young pine cone aroma. Hazelnut, chestnut, and bitter chocolate outline some malt nuances, and aluminum and iron introduce an extreme, crippling mineral weight.
Dry caramel, plum, and strawberry candy flavor; somewhat earthy, and full of esters with pear skin and flesh notes. Sandy notes of cardboard blend in with the caramel somewhat and are rather ignorable. Malt construction is sound, and the yeast contribution is classic. The depth is lacking.

Sugary mouthfeel, prickly and slick at the same time. This is an excellent example of the in-between nature of this style; sound and rounded in every way, while also thoroughly unable to leave an indelible impression.

Bottle from deeside drinks emporium. Pours a hazed dark brown with an off white head that lasts. Aromas of that typical Belgian yeast whiff with hints of grass and plum. Taste has a light pine with some grass with some sweet notes. Not bad.

33cl bottle from Dranken Pauwels. Poured in St. Bernardus glass (25cl edition). Nose: typical St Bernardus nose (their yeast?), fruity (plums), malty & sweet. Taste: sweet, candied sugar, malty, little bit of roast (burned). Aftertaste not that long lasting, lightly bitter and hints of wood. 

Not their best beer (IMHO) but still a great beer from a great brewery!
Een goed donker biertje met goed wat smaak aan. Geen van hun toppers, maar stelt zeker niet teleur
Clear dark ruby brown light brown lacing lasting foam head. Aroma is caramel, some nut, some hay tones. Drink little bitter, not too sweet. Quite nice. (Velp 201408)
Dark amber.. Dark white head medium lacing. Smell of bread and dark fruit. Nice smooth mouth feel. Taste is nicely balanced.. Sharp, tart, alcohol, with lots of yeast an malt notes. Great beer

33cl bottle at home. Clearish dark brown with a slightly off-white head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Sweet with herbal bitterness. Flowers, brown sugar, herbs, caramel and dark fruits. An ok dark brew.

11.2oz bottle poured into St. Bernardus goblet. Aged, with a 18-12-14 best by date. Pours a murky brown color with a lot of sediment. A medium sized head that dissipates to a thin crown with some lacing left behind.

Smell is of caramel malt, clove, and yeasty with dark fruit esters. 

Taste is heavy on the malt and dark fruits, mainly plums and figs. A good amount of spice from the yeast and a bit on the sweet side, but not overly, nicely balanced. Mouthfeel is medium-light, smooth and creamy. 

Overall, an excellent dubbel. Easy drinking and delicious.
Slightly hazy, Brown. Small, offwhite head. Aroma of brown sugar, yeast. Flavour has spice, prunes and pleasant alcohol. Carb is lively, creamy mouthfeel, very drinkable.
Molt bona cervesa del estil Abbey Ale, tot i que, no arriba a ser com una bona quàdruple. És molt recomanable.
Pours brown with small off white. Nutty aroma with something metallic. Taste is nutty with a hint of dark fruits. Good brown ale.

A dark amber/brown beer, slightly cloudy and well carbonated.
It has a thin foamy head, a good swirl will produce an abundance of surface foam thats pleasing to look at.
A smell a complex malt bill that is sweet with candied sugar.
Drinks with warming alcohol sweet malts and candied plums.
A thin light mouthfeel.
A good beer with lower more acceptable abvs meaning that I can drink a few, no problem.

Bottle at Tokishirasu, Kyoto. Dark muddy amber, fine thin head. Aroma of sticky malt, cola lozenge. Fine mouthfeel. Flavoursome, but not overly sticky. Light date, molasses, and fruity candy. Pretty good.
Pours a clouded amber with frothy lacing tan head. Notes of honey, a bit of stonefruit, yeast and hints of banana. Taste is moderately sweet with a bit of wood and a dry full finish.
Bottle at home. This struck me as a typical Belgian brew. Persistent head, bubbly carbonation, malty nose, slightly sweet and bitter taste. Fairly strong in alcohol compared with the other elements.
Peppermint candy cane, cola. And caramel aroma. Taste of peppermint candy and burnt toffee.
Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en La Birra. Color ambar oscuro. Sabor a levadura, malta, ligeramente especiado.

Bona cervesa, bastant equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, bastante equilibrada y sabrosa.
Buona dubbel, anche se assolutamente non ai livelli della sua sorella Prior 8 e di quella di La Trappe. Comunque, da provare.
33 cl bottle. Pours murky dark amber with some head. Nose is yeasty with some cloves, grain and banana. Taste is yeasty, light spicy, malty and light banana.

0,33 bottles purchased in Rome. Pours hazy chestnut skin color, creamy and tick ivory head which lasts long. Typical dubbel oily appearance. The nose is full of spicy notes, prunes and surprisingly grassy light notes. Mouth: not much of sweet notes but rather bitter overall feel along with malty notes and coconut aftertaste. Round feel of a balanced beer in perfect style. I assume that drunk at room temperature and with a bit of aging this beer offers it's best. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: APR 19, 2015 Bottle. Brown, hazy, minimal head, white foam, light sweetness, medium body, soft carbonation, & bitter finish.
A classic and a great example of a fine Belgian dubbel beer. Sweet, malty, yeasty and spicy.

Aroma: prunes, dark berries, caramel malts. Appearance: dark hazy brown, medium light beige frothy head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: caramel sweets, bread malts, light bitters lingering in the background, yet sweets dominate. Overall: fantastic Abbey Dubbel, great aroma and palate. Bottle from Beer of Belgium, Ypres.
Bottle to a snifter. Chestnut brown with thin tan head and lacing. Sweet maltiness, dark fruit, a bit of funk... Flavor is complex, plum, hazelnut, chocolate and spice. Well balanced and delicious.

Flaska från Beernavigator. Brunmurrig, relativt klar, beiget krämigt skum som bildar lock. Maltig och jästig lätt kryddig doft med mycket vörtkaraktär. Lätt, måttlig sötma för stilen, mycket vörtkaraktär, tydlig kryddig beska som klingar ut in i en fin eftersmak. En lätt trevlig dubbel som är välbalanserad och framförallt inte så söt vilket jag gillar, å andra sidan saknar jag lite fruktighet.

Bottle. Pours dark amber with quite huge white head. Aroma of dark fruits, raisins. Not so intensive. Taste is really balanced, sweet notes, but in a good way, something like confects... Highly carbonated.

Caña en cimmeria en 27-05-2014. Color marrón oscuro con espuma beige persistente. Sabores tostados y bastante maltosos con toques dulces. Cuerpo medio fácil de beber. Doble belga normal. Tomada en varias ocasiones en la época belga en botella. Normal.

330ml bottle. Pours a murky dark brown with creamy tan colored head. Aroma is fruity with notes of raisin. Medium bodied with somewhat sweet flavor along with some tartness. Smooth, creamy texture. This is quite tasty.

It has a dark brownish red colored body with a light haze and some yeast floaters. This is capped by a light beige head of frothy light foam. From the pour it left some yeast sediment on top of the head which looks like a dusting of cinnamon. The head hangs on well, slowly fading as I drink and making some nice lacing on the glass. There are fruity and estery yeast notes of raisins and apple peel with a slight hint of spice and funk. This is all comes with a nice sweet bready maltiness as well. Wow, moving on to taste this one has good complexity with fruity and spicy yeast, sweet bready and nutty malts. I get notes of cocoa powder blending with notes of walnuts and hazel nuts like Nutella within the sweet bready maltiness. Fruity notes remind me of raisins and as it warms I get some cherry as well. Hops are light and help to balance with mild bitterness and dryness in the finish. The palate has a solid medium body with mild carbonation. This beer has wonderful complexity and drinkability

11.2 oz. bottle from Hazels. Appearance: 2 fingers khaki head that does not last, amber chocolate color, cloudy, good lacing. Aroma: roast, light chocolate, molasses, prune like fruit, leaves and earthy. Palate: medium body, lively carbonation, oily texture, medium bitter lasting finish, dry finish. Taste: nice malty sweetness, molassesy, into medium bitter finish. Overall, balance is very nice, beer is very solid and just a nice drink.

Bottle pour. Cloudy brownish color with slightly brown head. Malty caramel bread aroma. Smooth palate with a Bread taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home from drinkstore. Pours deep brown with yellowy top. Head is off white foam which thins and disappears. Yeast, bread, cake, plum, cherry nose. Flavour is sweet bread malts, prune, plum, cherries. Slight bitterness on finish. Fruity lift at end. Mild carbonation. Alcohol is well managed. This Brewer provide light bodied beers full of flavour and intricacy. Good beer.
Krótko i na temt jak piana w koncerniaku. Typowy przedstawiciel belgijskich ale zapachy kwiatowe i owocowe, w smaku słodowość złamana nutą orzechów, lekki alkohol na finiszu. Mniam!

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dimas. Thanks Vova. BBD 11/2009. Clear brown-bronze with a frothy white head. Vinous, cherry, very oxidized aroma.Strong honey taste. Medium body, sweet finish with soft carbonation and sour undertones.

Dark hazy brownish amber, fine creamy light beige head. Sweet smell, fruits (plums, raisins), caramel, some alcohol and a light vegetal chestnut. Very good taste with sweet malts, caramel, plums, light toasted note, nice light hops in the finish.

Très bonne bière belge!!
Très bien équilibré et agréable à boire.
J aime bien les St Bernardus :)

Excellent, malty goodness. Nose is roasted chestnuts, maple. Taste is well balanced, with a touch of earthiness offsetting the sweetness. Everything I've had from St Bernardus is great, and this is is no exception. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Dranken Pauwels. Murky chestnut brown, huge off white foam head out of the bottle which dissipates to thin. Nice nose of home writerly singing earthy hops, nutmeg spice, caramel, rich plummy, date and prune dark fruit. Taste is malty, caramel, nutmeg, little bit of that dried fig and prune. The carbonations gone a bit because it gushed, but this really impressed me as a fragrant and tasty malty Belgian beer. Lacks the kick of an 8 or 12 but its balance is beautiful.
Great for ending a hearty meal, or for accompanying a hearty, sweet dessert. Rich body, strong taste of dark chocolat.
Bottle at home. Murky muddy brown, thin quickly fading tan head. Aroma of apricot, nuts, some spice. Flavour similar with a bit of caramel, dark fruit. Quite a good example of the style, enjoyed it.

Bottle shared with Lyoli in Gabrovo, Bulgaria - sourced from beermerchants. Pours lightly hazy brown with a frothy, off-white head that settles down quickly. The aroma engages with moderate ripening, semi-dark fruits, some dried berries, mellow Belgian yeast, some toffee. Medium sweet flavor with decent caramel-bread malt character, some hints of cocoa and toasted toffee, more rounded fruit notes, some plums and dates. Medium to full bodied with lively, mouth-filling carbonation. Lightly warming on the finish with more ripened fruits, toffee, bread, fruitcake, candied sugar, dates. Nicely balanced, with good complexity, and highly drinkable

Bottle @ home, bbf 2014-01. Dull copper-brown colored with a good light beige head. Aroma has yeast, lots of it, leaning towards bread yeast. Theres also caramel, fudge, dark bread, ripe bananas, spices, clove, raisins, vanilla, vinous plums & a note of oak.Complex and interesting, although a bit too yeasty. Flavor is sweet of fudge, bread, spices, banana and notes of banana peel. Clove, brown sugar, wood and dark fruits and light notes of chocolate . Aftertaste is dry and nutty, with some papery aging artifacts. Dry medium bitterness. Soft carbonation.
UPDATED: MAY 8, 2014 Bottle. Pours medium brown with a medium beige head. Pleasant bitter-sweet taste, palate bananas, leaving a tart aftertaste. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours reddish brown with an off white fluffy head. Aroma is dark fruit, banana, spice and yeast. Taste is sweet with some very mild tartness. Medium bodied, smooth, soft carbonation.
Bottle. Pours a nice white head. Color a cloudy dark copper. Nose is some raisins. Very sweet flavor. Classic dubbel.
Hazy brown pour, thick off white head. Nose is malt. Bittersweet. Middle is ripe hard fruit and medium malt. Finish is slightly sweet and coats the tongue.

Had this sitting in my frig for a while now and I was waiting for a good reason to open it up. My reason..........Monday. What better cure for the Monday blues than a Trappist ale? 

Pours a murky brownish-red with a thick fluffy tan head. Aroma is slightly more subdued that I was expecting. Hints of bitter fruits, molasses, apricot, banana, and a trace of alcohol. Flavor is akin to the aroma. Not in your face, but coats your palate in a pleasant array of flavors. Raisin, caramelized brown sugar, slight hop bitterness, and just the right amount of warmth from the alcohol. Feels very soft on the palate. Overall a very easy to drink, pleasant beer. I prefer the Rochefort 6 but this one still makes a solid appearance.
d ecouleur brune ambre abec col blanc on n a des de malte en bouche on goute un légeremnt gout sucre comme le caramel et gout malté bonne biere mais beaucouip corsé que les autre st bernardus

A- Pours a murky brown hue with a huge, chunky, 2.5 finger beige head.

S- Slightly yeasty, hints of chocolate

T- Chocolate, sweet pear, cherry, slight hop bitterness.

M- Medium bodied with medium/high carbonation.

D- Very drinkable. The high carbonation detracts a little for me but im sure it is good with some age on it.

caramelbruin, helder met schuimige kaki kraag. redelijk kleverig
aroma van redelijke caramel, gist, moutig, zoet, 
smaken zijn redelijk kandij suikerzoet, zwak bitter, zwak fruitig van oa donkere en overrijpe fruiten (pruim/banaan en rozijn), 
medium tot volle body, romig in de mond, lage co2, en een zoete afdronk. zachte en gladde maar goede abdij tripel !
Bue en bouteille de 33CL. Couleur ambrée foncée. Bonne dans lensemble même si peu délément se distinguent.

Bu en bouteille de 33cl, acheté en Belgique javoue que jen avais jamais vu en France, couleur brune mousse blanche très peu de tenue, une attaque assez intense sur le grillée et le sucre, très honnête et intéressante à redéguster
Nice reddish amber color with a thick white head. Sweet tastes of malt, fruit, and caramel with a slight bitter finish.
Pours a dark brown. Aroma and taste are caramel and some dark fruits with a lingering aftertaste.
Hazy brown color , mid-sized off-white head. Aroma of fruits , caramel and yeast. Taste of caramel malt , fruits , spices and yeast. Dry bitterness in aftertaste. Good beer.

33cl bottle @ home. Dark brown color, strong medium brownish head. Aroma caramel, roasted malt, slightly fruity, licorice, herbs, glucose. Taste light sweetness, medium bitterness, salty notes. Full body, creamy texture, lively carbonation, medium bitterish finish. Average abbey dubbel, not bad, not too exciting.
Bottle. Hazy brown/orange with a small beige head. Aroma and flavor of fruits, caramel, clove, must, and anise. Finish is bitter and spicy.

0,33L bottle, BB 25.04.2016. Pours dark red amber with off white head. The head stays. Aroma is caramel, malt, and yeast. Taste is malt, caramel, dark fruits, and spices. Finish is candy sweetness and dry bitter. Overall: nice beer, but I prefer "8" and "12".
Nettes, leich schokoladiges und malziges Dubbel, das gar einfach zu trinken ist. Dabei erwärmend und mildsüß abschließend. Klassisch und in Ordnung.
Vrai biere dabbaye comme je les aiment des notes de chocolat le dépôt et vraiment bon

Pours out of the bottle in a deep dark brown colour with creamy low head and smooth body. Nice aroma of raisins, malt and chocolate. Taste of malt, rum, plums, berries, chocolate and Belgian yeast. Typical Belgian beer style, nothing very special at all - there is something that keeps me away of enjoying Belgian beers. But nevertheless this one is quite nice and drinkable with a lighter character and body.
33cl fles. Donkere kleur. Witte volle schuimkraag. Eerste smaakimpressie : fris, bloemig, koolzuur. Lekker biertje.

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes rötlichbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch nach getrockneten Früchten, Hefe, Karamell.
Geschmack hefig, Karamell, Früchte, leicht gewürzig.

Bottle from Great Grog. Chestnut body with a thin off-white head that gradually fades. Light lacing. Aroma of dark fruit, caramelised sugar with a green, minty note. Mild flavour of grass, green apple, toffee and stewed tea. Medium body with an oily texture. Nice fizz. A bit messy, but still tasty. This bottle was marked best before May 2016 - maybe the version I tried was too young.

Location/Date:Bottle on March 2nd, 2014.
Appearance: Pours a murky maroon with light white head. 
Aroma: Aroma of light dark fruit, lightly yeasty.
Taste: Similar to the aroma, darker fruit, lightly doughy, light nutty malt.
Palate:Light body.
Summary: The first bottle in a 4 pack of St. Bernardus beers, a solid example of the traditional belgian style.

Dark brown with burgundy hues and a small beige head. The aroma is caramelized sugar, dates, and yeast. The flavor is somewhat mild compared to the aroma. Comes off as watered down licorice, which is not as bad as it sounds. Lots of carbonation of course.

Pours a deep cloudy copper with some sediment and a 2 finger white head. A curious blend if a Belgian Trippel and an American lager. Difficult to categorize it but pretty good brew. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @home shared with the wife. Pours dark copper. Not as fruity as the 12 (shock horror) slightly more bitter than i expected, tough of green veg about this. I had this too young, three years left on the best by date.

Bottle @home. Pours dark chestnut with a nice creamy white head. Aroma is spicy and alcohol (what I didnt really expect from 6,7%). Aroma is chocolate, slight bitterness, bit sweet. Finish is dry. The alcohol is more noticeable than I expected. Nice one, but not the Abt 12.

Poured a 1 finger white head. Appearance is a murky dark copper. Some sediment. Aroma is the classic Belgian yeast and raisins. Carb is high. Taste excellent. Overall very pleased and would purchase again.
Drinking this youd expect it to be of a higher alcohol percentage. An overall nice beer with hints of roasted nuts and chocolate.
Pretty basic Belgian flavor, spicy yeast etc. A bit of nut flavor shines through, maybe some toast. I think this bottle is a little on the cold side. Decent, but no Abt 12.

Nice pour, hazy brown in color, good head. A nice aroma, getting some, grapes, raisins or figs, dark fruit, sweet and sour aroma. Malt, dough, raisins, almost chocolate flavor, lite bitters and dark fruit taste. Very good beer!
Brune marron clair. Nez de malt, de caramel et de biscuit. Amertume moyenne. Goût de malt et pain grillé.

Spicy aroma with banana, spices (nutmeg, cloves), yeast, and sweet malty notes (candi sugar, a bit of molasses). Moderately bitter taste with some sweetness and yeasty tartness. Medium-to-thin body overcome by spritzy, foamy carbonation that gets in the way. The palate simply does not cooperate. Very good otherwise.

Pours a deep amber color with a good foamy head that fades slowly to nice lacing. Aroma of dark fruit, with bit of malt sweetness yeast and spice. Taste has a nice light malt sweetness with dark fruit mixed in and a touch of spice. Mild bitterness and the finish is quite dry. Medium body, smooth with abundant character. Very well balanced. Enjoyable beer that hit the spot.

Cloudy chestnut color, nice beige head, vanishes almost completely quickly, some lacing; sweet malty nose, caramel, brwon sugar, bread, toast, herbs, clove, bit cinnamon, dough; medium sweet, medium bitter, dark fruit, coffee; full body, creamy texture; roasty bittersweet finish, bit spicy.
Aroma: Malty, caramel, bit of cheese(yeast) Appearance: Amber, clear, little yeast, frothy head, slowly disappearing, medium lace Taste: Caramel, yeast, hint of chestnut, little dry finish

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A brown-orange beer with a medium beige head not very persistent. Fruity aroma, caramel, spices, clove and musty. In a recent review, @Hopswagger wrote "black bottom part of a banana" and I agree with him. Medium bitter, medium sweet, light sour. Medium body, thin texture, bitter finish. Good lacing. Overall, Im disappointed. Complex aroma but unpleasant notes. I have to check it again.

Thanks Mike. Cloudy brown. Typical Belgian look. Little sediment if any :( Very spicy. Clove, nutmeg, hops, touch of anise, yeast, wheat, ripe fruit skins. Bitter and spice go back and forth. Dusty through out. Very little sweetness. Tasty and mild.

P: A speckled mahogany body with a dollop of off white head that fades to a bubbly wake. 

S: A controlled caramel, great Belgian yeast strain, subdued sweet dark fruits, clove, the black bottom part of a banana, pumpernickel bread and spicy hops. Aroma is similar to a musty cardboard fruit container. 

T/M: Malty caramel, bready yeast, dark fruits, booze, and spices. Vivacious medium body that finishes dry with green apple tartness and bitter spiced tea tannin. 

O: Complex and perfectly balanced. I gotta say I love it and want some more of it. The balance is what really shines here. Not over barring in any way but just nicely married. Cheers!

Tasting at RW&B. Bottle->stem. Murky reddish brown white moderate offwhite head. Great aroma and flavor of dark fruits, sweet malt, Belgian yeast. Fairly light palate for the style. Smooth and delicious..

Bottle. Pours murky red brown with pillowy khaki head. Good retention and stringy lacing. Aroma is sweet, plum, fig, banana, and alcohol. Flavor is sweet, strong pear, banana with a fruity, caramel malt finish. Moderate carbonation and medium body.

Ive been keeping this for a while. Now its time. Murky, ruddy chestnut brown, generous carbonation and little lacing. Nice dollop of sediment at the end. Cinnamon toast, caramel, nuts, and forest fruits all present in the complex, warming aroma. Taste is modestly sweet but never cloying: simple and balanced. The palette is extraordinarily tingly and silky. It is hard to beat a Dubbel of this quality.

Bottle from Global TAP in Delray Beach, FL. Have had many times but first time rating it. Goblet. Pours a dark amber-reddish brown with a thick, foamy white head. Aroma of dark fruits and sugars, bread, grains, and slight booze. The taste really hit those awesome Belgian yeasts, dark fruits, and malts. Medium body, rather dry finish. Lighter than some Dubbels. But very good as always.

33cl bottle, bb05/2013
Aroma has herbs, light licorice, bit booze, dried fruit.
Pours amber, tiny sparkling, nice large off-white head, lasting, lacing, thick foam.
Taste is sweet, malt, sugar, ripe banana, something grainy.
Light bitter, dry finish, medium bodied, soft mouthfeel.
I liked this one, like most of the Bernardus beers!
330ml bottle. Many times years ago. A quite good abbey ale. Some roasty, sweet, liquorice, caramel flavours. Pretty enjoyable.
Bottle at home from ales by mailclear dark ruby with full beige head. Rich candy sugar, plums and yeast esters on nose, full bodied, low carbonation, sweet malt, fruity. Decent dubbel, unusual!

Ar: Plum, peach, slight oxydation - light brown sugar - some moss and mineral water.
Ap: Amber-red, hazy - medium light tan head with moderate retention, leaves a thin, almost solid cap of foam.
T: Toasted malt, mossy hops - some hints of light brown sugar - medium-high, rough bitterness - some peach and orange rind.
P: Light body with high carbonation - comes off as a bit watery - finish is dry.
O: This beer smelled good, but came off as flabby, with subdued flavors.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Dark ruby brown with medium head that quickly reduces to residual head. Aroma of toffee, dark fruits and dark malts. Taste is toffee, dark fruits, grape juice, some sweet sugars and some yeast. Quite a lot of carbonation that forces the flavours to fizz on the tongue. Quite good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text:
Foamy beige head with some herbal aroma. Dark copper body. Spicy flavors with light malt hints and residual sweetness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Quite nice beer but nothing really special about it. Just your average abbey beer. The bottle is a bit funny tho and it tastes alright. Drinkable but not a personal favourite.
The head is medium, the body brown. it smells sweet-fruity, a bit barley-alcoholic. The taste is malty, a bit wooden-dry, bitter-alcoholic. Ok
Has the same sugar sweet strong aroma of many dubbels/abts. The flavor is certainly much maltier than an average Belgian. decent.

Bottle from a shop in Belgium, bought in october 2011, best before 2014. Dried fruit and caramelized sugar on the nose. Similar taste, the sugar draws towards honey and flowers. Round and aged flavour. Very nice.

Világosbarnás-vöröses szín, opálos, élesztődarabkákkal. Világosbézs habkorona, tökéletes megjelenés. Édes, gyümölcsös illat, halványan élesztős is. Olajos állag, mérsékelten szénsavas. Íze lágyan égetettcukros és aszaltgyümölcsös. Utóíze lágyan komlós.

(Bottle): Pours a dark brown with a tan head. Aroma of dark fruits, sweet malt, yeast, caramel, toast. Flavour is sweet and rich. Quite malt forward with dark fruits, namely raisins. Caramel, bread, yeast, slight chocolate notes too. Nice stuff.

Flasche (33 cl). - Schönes Rotbraun. Nase appetitlich karamelsüß-würzig. Antrunk intensiv karamelsüß und würzig: Röstmalz, Lakritz, Rohrzucker, Portwein, Feigen, dazu eine mentholartig-kühlende Note. Schlankes Mundgefühl. Gut hopfenherber Abgang. - Außerordentlich aromatisches Dubbel - da haben manche stärkeren Biere weniger Geschmack zu bieten.

Bottle at Six Degrees North. It pours hazy deep brown with a medium beige head. The nose is toast, cocoa, raisin, date, dried fig, earth and damp wood. The taste is bitter-sweet, wood, earth, spice, dried fruit, caramel, toast, leather and a touch of alcohol. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Tasty and well balanced. A great dubbel.
12 ounce bottle. Dark pour. Slightly sweet, caramel toffee dried fruit yeasty bottle of lovely Tasty.

Bottle 0.33L.
Hazy, brown/reddish body with an average, creamy, tan head, mostly lasting with nice lacing.
Moderate-to-heavy malty (caramel, roasted) aroma with fruity (banana, red fruits) an nutty notes.
Moderate sweet flavour with moderate-to-heavy bitter and dry finish. 
Dry body with velvet texture; soft carbonation.

Pours russet with transient small head. Aroma is belgian yeast - offering up some banana notes -, some plum and decent amount of toffee. A subdued but quality bouquet.
Decent amount of carbonation - reflected in a spritzy soft palate. A little thin on the backend, otherwise sturdy. Taste is some sweet dark fruit on front palate - cherry, some plum. Then yeast and chocolate, which builds commendably. Almost no bitterness aside from some that in residual malt. Beautifully balanced, and perfectly competent, it just feels slightly restrained.
Reddish brown colour. Aroma is toffee, caramel. Medium bodied, malty, caramel.

[ASPETTO] 			
ambra scuro tendente al marrone, opaca; schiuma beige, media finezza, buona presenza, media persistenza			
[OLFATTO]			
zucchero caramellato, toffe, lieviti, note speziate e un tocco di frutta matura, sentori alcolici			
[GUSTO]			
approccio dolce, senza esagerare, malto tostato, caramello, miele; qualche nota di liquirizia, cola; un leggero tocco acidulo ed un finale tendente a note amaricanti, leggero speziato e toni liquorosi 			
[TEXTURE]			
corpo medio, carbonazione briosa, mantenendo comuqnue una certa morbidezza al palato			
[COMMENTO FINALE]			
abbey con tutte le sue buone caratteristiche, ben dosate ed armoniche: un appropriato tocco amaricante smorza le note maltose e liquorose, alcohol si fa notare ma rispetta il suo ruolo di comprimario. Carbonazione forse un po sopra le righe e consistenza al palato leggerina.
330ml bottle shared with jeevan. Pours murky reddish brown with a frothy white head. Aromas of Belgian yeast and toffee. Taste is sweet. Finishes surprisingly thin. Disappointing to be honest,
bottle at a bar. Poured redisch brown colour with a medium white head butter, dark malts, cherries, liquor, roasted malts, dried fruits, belgian yeast, low on carbonation.

Nose is herbs, cinnamon, fruit cake, yeast. Taste is belgian yeast, pepper and cloves, leading to malt, toast and a sweeter finish, with some grass. Its a touch carbonated and a little thin for me. A really nice dubble, which avoids the oversweetness of the style.

2008

Pours murky cola mahogany, finger white head.

Smell juicy prune, big chewy fruit.

Taste sweet coco roast, fruit on tail

Med body, sweet

Nice

Reddish brown with lasting offwhite head; aroma of sweet plum with hint t of cinnamon and yeast; Flava is mild yet full notes of raisin and grassy malt; feels luxuriously medium with nice sexy foam/fizz; finishes dry yet sweet slightly bitter

Bottle: murky, dark-ish copper & brown with some off-white sediment particles inside the brew. Khaki foam rests on top; creamy, thick, & long-lasting. Aroma contains notes of ripe, sour grapes, apple skins, tons of phenol, toasted malts, steel-y caramel, earthy esters, & Belgian yeast. A mild sweet-tartness is present in the back-end. Taste is full of sweet, sugar-coated grapes & plums with some cranberry notes that come with a mild tartness mid-palate. Earthy, dirty hops come alive with sweet fruit esters behind them; spices more apparent with time (mainly clove). Touch of finishing bitterness, aftertaste of wine-soaked bread & clove. Solid dubbel, good balance of earthiness, bitterness, sweetness, & even a touch of tartness.

Aroma: Sulphur smell with light fruitiness

Taste: light sweet fruitiness that finishes very hoppy

Appearance:dark amber body with medium froth body, fairly clear with some sediment

330ml bottle, ours deep amber golden brown with a large foamy head. Aroma is sweet caramel syrup and banana, coriander and belgian yeast esters. Finish is malty but bitterness comes through and the finish is dry & crisp. Lively carbonation.

Chilled bottle, BB 2015. Dark red, sparkling, quite clear, big bubbly white head. Looks decent. Smell - Belgian yeast, a touch of swimming pool, malty. Body is medium, quite foamy. Taste - milky coffee up front, maybe some dark fruits coming through, finish is a bit nondescript. Overall, theres not a lot to describe here. Its OK at best. At least it looks quite good.
Drunk in 33cl bottle, red / brown color with persistent beige head, sweet aroma with caramel malt notes, in mouth is smooth, light roasted and equilibrate in sweet and bitter notes, good dubbel beer!

Fies anzusehendes, trübes Dunkelbraun mit üppiger Schaumbildung. Hefig-süßliches Aroma nach Sultaninen und Pflaumenkuchen. Auch im Geschmack hefig-fruchtig, kaum süß. Der zartbittere Abgang hat eine leichte, aber kaum störende Alkoholnote. Sehr süffig, wenn auch nicht sonderlich komplex.
Nice light brown. Raisins, caramel, pineapple, quite fresh. Medium body, some alcohol present, nice carbonation. Prerry good, but slightly too light on the taste.

Bottle 0.33l from brewery. Pours hazy brown with fast vanishing head. Aroma is malt, caramel, molasses . Taste is low bitterness, medium sweetness, dried fruit, plum. Good abbey beer for 6.7 ABV which of course lacks the punch of prior and abt.

Pours a cloudy brown with a small off-white head. Aroma of malts, yeast, slight caramel, light dried fruits. Medium sweetness.This is a nice enough brew, but the Prior 8 and especially the 12 are better.
Not bad, but Bernardus has better beers! It has full body and color, tastes a bit chocolate like. I prefer the Prior 8 or Abt.

Bottle shared at a tasting. Pours hazy brown with a small off-white head. Aroma of dried dark fruits, caramel, toffee and yeast. Sweet with dried fruits, raisins, caramel and mild bitterness. Medium-bodied, creamy texture, good drinkability. Nice beer.
Bottle sample at a tasting at Yoavs place. Thanks zvsn. Pours an hazy brown with a small head, aroma of honey, plums, fruits, flavor of dark bread, nice sweetness, some fruity tones, medium bodied

Bottle sample at a tasting at Yoavs place. Thanks zvsn. Hazy brown. Aroma of caramel, yeast and dark fruits. Sweetish flavor with dark fruits, caramel and a drier finish with a light spicy note. Medium-bodied. Decent.

Dark almost cloudy brown pour with an off white head on top. Sweet and sugary smell. Wheat bread and chocolate malts. Nice bitter, malty and dark heavy wheat brown bread in the taste. Love the lingering bitter aftertaste. Something sweet in there I cant put my finger on. Mouthfeel is a bit on the thin side for my likings. But still a nice abbey.

Bottle. Medium sized light brown head. Nut brown, foggy. Aroma has yeast and orange. 

Taste has malt, orange and wood. Nice full body with a crisp bitter note. Aftertaste has some tobacco in it. A bit shallow in comparison to the quadrupels and such, but very good on its own.

Bottle. Yeast, candi sugar, light roast malt, and some edge of funik. Clear light tea color, thin beige head. Rough and beautiful fruit in the initial, some raisins, some nutty notes too / sweetness mellows nicely in mid, nearly balanced, with a little carb tingle / finishes mild and smooth. Very good. A solid dubbel. Smooth and full, but not overly sweet.

APPEARANCE: dark brown beer, nice stable beige head. NOSE: quite some malts, chocolate, somewhat fruity even. TASTE: heavy malty, though little more watery, not so much carbonation. Not bad, but Bernardus has better beers!

330ml bottle. Whoa. Contents under pressure. I opened this guy up, and it reached for the sky. Pours a hazy chestnut, with a GIANT tan head. The nose is dried fruit, malt, light, brown sugar, and doughy, bread crust like notes. Taste is dry, alcohol, bread crust, light dried fruit, spice in the finish, almost a menthol like note too. Liquid bread. Its tasty, and a nice change from the sweeter, dried fruit forward Belgians.

330ml Bottle. It pours a deep reddish brown with a light tan medium laced and long lasting head,. Its aroma is fruity and sweet with hints of caramel, chocolate and malt. Its taste is initially sweet followed by raisins, coffee, dark coca bean with a malty toffee finish that passes to dry end. Lovely beer this!

Bold mousy brown color. Spirited carbonation. Fruity and malty. Clean finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a dark brown with a small off white head. Aroma is malt, yeast, and fruit. Taste is great with lots of fruit and malt. Very tasty.

330cc bottle. Dark muddy brown color. Medium-high carbonation. Head is off white and not very stable. Aroma of malt, vanilla, citrus and yeast. Taste is sweet with low bitterness. Overall - much better than it looks.
Pours nice off white head. Smells citrics , malt. Amber colour. Taste malty. Some bitterness but overall as good as advertised

Aroma: banana, caramelo, frutas vermelhas. No copo, belo corpo, bela espuma, marrom terra. Sabor: maltado, com amargor balanceado e um toque amadeirado. No palato,uma leve rascância no final da língua. No geral, uma boa cerveja, com leve percepção de álcool no nariz.
Smell of oak and cognac. Hazy dark brown colour, beige head. Aroma of oak, cognac, rum. Very fizzy and rich carbon. Sweet with some bitterness.

BOTTLE 33CL.

Head: beige, medium, frothy, avg. retention. Colour: red, cloudy.

Aroma: fruity, some boiled vegetables too, some faint harsh solvent-like notes.

Taste: mostly sweet, slight phenolic alcohol dries up the sweetness.

Somewhat disappointing.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2014 33cl bottle at Vooruit Terrace.
APPEARANCE: dark brown beer, nice stable beige head.
NOSE: quite some malts, chocolate, somewhat fruity even.
TASTE: heavy malty, though little more watery, not so much carbonation.
Not bad, but Bernardus has better beers!


33cl bottle. Thx to mathieu87. Bottle nearly expired. APPEARANCE: dark Brown beer, small stable beige head. NOSE: caramel, malts, rather sweet, some herbs. TASTE: malts, caramel, some herbs, nice, some port. Nice beer in general!
Pours a dark brown with a large, slightly tanned head. Slightly bready aroma with caramel and banana. Nice alcohol finish.

Bottle at the hotel in Omaha. Pour is murky brown-amber with a small tan head and good lacing. Sweet caramelly, brown sugar, bananay, toffee, light raisin, plummy, cherry, and yeasty aroma. Taste is candi sugar, Belgian yeast, light banana, dark fruits, somewhat bready, tangy, red grapes, and cocoa. Full mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Pretty tasty Dubbel.

Pours a glowing cloudy amber with a billowing head of big bubbles that slowly dies down to a film. Aroma is wonderful and fresh: caramel, herbs, dough, alcohol, and apricot. The taste is near perfection of balance. Medium body, creamy, lively, with a powerful astringent endgame. A fine product. Will drink lots more of this in the near future.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2014 33cl. Bottle. 
Pours hazy brown with tan head. 
Aroma cherry, sweet, caramel, dark malts, dark fruit, spice. 
Taste caramel sweet, spicy bitter. 
Mouthfeel, creamy, high carbo. 
Nice dubbel.
In bottle; Budapest .. great beer ... dark chestnut brown color ... taste of cocoa and almost root beer. Very good beer and would definitely buy again
330ml bottle. pours a rich brown with velvety head. aroma is of alcohol, plums and yeast. tastes fantastic. super smooth with full mouth feel. perfect at room temperature.
Pours a dark auburn with a rich foamy head. Aroma is sweet with dark fruits and rich with alcohol. Flavor is potent. Rich sweet malty sweetness with notes of plum and fig. Very nice.

Bottle, 330 ml, into a tulip glass. ABV 6.7%
Deep chestnut brown colour with nice deep ruby shades when hold against the light. Clear body. Two fingers of off-white head, good density,average retention. Medium thick lacing left on the glass.
Aroma of light roasted malts, wood, maybe a bit of smoke.
Taste of dark malts, a touch of chocolate. Mildly sweet.
Medium thick body, good carbonation, notable on the tongue. 
Overall, I expected a bit more from this one, much better the Prior 8.
Poured deep reddish brown with a frothy tan head. Aroma of caramel malt, dark fruit. Medium body, reasonable carbonation, flavour as the aroma, candy sweet. Average Dubbel.

15th February 2013Almost opaque dark brown beer with a good pale cream coloured head. Palate is airy and a little dry. Fine sharp carbonation. Dusty seltzer yeast. Mild creamy malt. Touches of tangy fruits and molasses. Dry finish. A bit messy but drinkable.
Pours hazy brown with nice head. Aroma is rich malts and yeast, taste is smooth and velvety, great dubbel

My least favorite of the Bernardus line. A bit tart without the belgian yeast flavor that Ive come to love. A bit of a strange taste in the middle. I dont want to call it metallic, but its some sort of off taste similar. Not very bitter. Definitely fruity though. Looks great though, tons of lace and a thick dark caramel color.
Very nice beer bottle from Randall's in St. Louis. Reddish brown pour. Malty and bready. Slightly sweet with some bitterness on the finish. Nice beer.

Bottle from Saveur cons 2013-08-22 Göteborg
AR: caramel, pruns, rasine cake
AP: mahogny, frothy wee beige head
F: soft carbonation, caramel, pruns, rasine cake, english toffee. medium bitterness

bottle @ antwaerps bierhuyske
pours brown, with a red glow. good white head. smells rather sweet, yeasty .
too much carbo, sugary, perfumed. OK..

Date on bottle 2011. Appears a hazy deep brown with orange highlights. The head is tan and full. The smell is caramel..lots of caramel and dark fruit. Taste follows nose with some must, spice, a touch of chocolate - a little dry on the end. Medium body with nice tight carbonation. Great stuff!
Mooie roodbruine caramel kleur met een volle schuimkraag. Geur van mout caramel. Smaakt fris zoetig met tonen van caramel en een iets bittere nasmaak.
Even though its a good beer, I prefer the 8 and 12. This one has all the good features but its kinda weak compare to the others. Less intense but still nice.
Bottle 0.33l at home. BBE 24 03 15. Colour is brown with small slightly brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Dark fruits, raisins, sweetness, hints of yeast, caramel and malts.

Hazy deep orange colour. Nose is fruity. Medium body, correct carbon, slight texture. Taste is semibitter. Palate is overhelmed by cocoa, caramel and chicory. [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */

Bottle. Pours clear amber with small off-white head. Clear aroma of malt, caramel and fruit. Sweetish, malty flavour with notes of fruit, caramel and a mild hoppy note. Mild, slightly sweet finish. High carbonation. Nice.

Pours an average frothy off-white head that mostly diminishes. Body is murky red brown. 
Aroma contains light malts (light bread, molasses), light hops (citrus fruits), light yeasts (dough) and grape, raisin, cherry, cassis, tawny port and cola.
Flavor starts off light acidic, to go to sweet and faint bitter.
Body is medium, with creamy texture and soft carbonation.
It's fresh, it's light, it's gooooood!
Kruidig, hoestdrank en pannenkoek met stroop in aroma. Smaak is kruidkoek, cola extract en diezelfde stroop, die de nasmaak domineert samen met zuurstok zoetigheid. Donker bier op goede kraag.

From the corked caged bottle. The cork popped by itself when I wasnt looking. It pours deep amber with red hues. Good aroma of Belgian sugar, Belgian yeast, caramel malts, some overripe dark fruit and spice. Medium to full body. The taste is full of sweetness and a low to moderate bite at the end.

Enjoyed my St. Bernardus Pater 6 much more on its own. Initial consumption was part of STB flight (anticipated Abt 12). On its own merits, a fine Belgian Dubbel. Work well paired with Italian-herbed Pork chops. Still a bit too sour fruity for me, this was due more credit than I gave it the last time.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle served in a St. Bernardus chalice
Bottle date - 27 07 15

A - Tawny brown with a wettish off-white head that forms a wispy cap.

S - Spiced banana bread, clove, cinnamon, caramel grain, raisins, plums, sublime aroma.

T - Brown sugar, spicy and peppery yeast, spiced bread, like the aroma, clove and cinnamon, plantains, hints of prunes, some grassy hops show at the end.

M - Moderate carbonation, floats across the palate, medium body.

Pater 6 showcases Christmas spices and sugary, bready malts. Theres also plenty of fruit esters as well. Excellent mix of flavors that really hit the spot around Christmas time.

Serving type: bottle

12-30-2012

Bottle from the beer palais at Watou, Belgium. Pours chestnut brown, beautifully dark fragrance with some fantastic yeast flavours knockin about. St Bernardus never disappoints and Pater 6 is definitely up there with the greats.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2014 A bit lighter than I expect from a double, but an amazingly fruity, malty delicious beer. Pours brown with a large amount of head and fizz. Medium mouthfeel and light on bitterness. Aroma is exactly like a freshly baked loaf of bread.
Bottle. Brown colour with a large off-white head. Aroma of dried fruit, caramel, spices. Flavour is malt, caramel, spices, yeast, hops.

Bottle. Pours hazy reddish amber, small tan head, fizzy, some lacing. Sins is spicy, toffee, dried fruit, cherry, yeast. Flavor is the same, medium sweet, minimal bitterness. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel, a touch of astringent.
UPDATED: FEB 13, 2014 brown top stays long. Coffee aroma,bit acid. Taste chocolate, dark bread. Light Bitterness
Bottle @ Home. Pours brown with offwhite head. Aroma of malt, yeast, candi sugar, spice. Flavor is malt, yeast, licorice, spice, sugar, dark fruits. Medium body, average carbonation.
deep brown color, haze and thick. great malt nose like double. medium taste with lots of carb.
Amber colored, lots of carbonation wth a thick, lasting beige head. Smells fresh and a bit of citrus. Sweet taste, full body. Great beer.

Very cloudy brown appearance. Aroma of dark fruit, malt sweetness, a bit leathery and some oakiness, belgian sugar. Taste matched the aroma with classic belgian yeast characteristics. Full body, nice mouthfeel that really coated the mouth with some creaminess. Overall a very nice example of the style and worth trying, but probably wouldnt seek it out again.

Slight crisp cherry and other dry fruit scent with a little pete and grain. Off white foamy head and dark red broen body. kinda dry cherry  with a slight cinnamon spice flavor some earthy notes as well as a mild biscuit flavor. Smooth with a crisp spice on the palate.

Pours red brown with medium white head
Aromas of oak, butter, dark malts, cherries, hints of molasses
Taste is liqourize, roasted malts, dry fruits, belgo yeast, cherries
Medium bodied, low carbonation, Could have more body
Brune avec dépôt en suspension, mousse beige persistante sur 1/2 cm, huileuse au palais, sécheresse sur la fin. Caramel dominant avec notes dépices, légère amertume en arrière-bouche.
Smooth, delicious abbey dubbel. Pours almost clear dark brown, minimal head, aroma of dried fruits and caramel. Mild bitterness, light mouthfeel, lingering finish. One of the better trappist beers.

Bottle at Taps Beer Bar, Kuala Lumpur. Poured a deep brown colour with a long-lasting frothy head. The aroma is dry yeast and nuts. The flavour is medium bitter with that Belgian yeasty edge & malt and liqourice on the palate and into the smooth finish. A very nice beer indeed.
33cl from Auchan (Luxembourg). Brownish colour with a nice head. Medium carbonation. Some alcohol in the nose but a nice beer, though.

Pour is reddish brown, slight haze, creamy brown tinted head. Aroma is walnut, bread dough, fig, cloves, some alcohol, cinnamon. Taste ids rich roasted malt, nuttiness, plum and fig, cloves and cinnamon, ginger lingering on the back, banana. Body is medium heavy, crisp light carbonation.

Pours a light brown/mahogany with 1 finger of off-white that dissipates quickly. Decent amount of lacing. Nose is a mix of caramel, malt, dark fruits and spice. A strong aroma, mainly plum, anise, ginger and a little bit of alcohol, hit you strong up front. Very pleasing. Mouth is very sweet up front. a decent amount of caramel, raisin, spices and a lot of malt. Has a moderately bitter finish that lingers a bit.
Pours with a good head, although it doesnt last too well. Sweetness, malt, cherries, sugar and alcohol. Really enjoyable beer from a great brewery.

Bought a bottle at Berts Bierhuis. Aroma of toasted caramel and a fruit plate. Has a dark brown color and a light brown head, which stays a long time and is highly carbonated. Has a medium body, a balanced sweetness and some tones of walnuts, the aftertaste is quite long and has some light bitters. Afterall, a good Abbey Dubbel, but the prior 8 is just a little better.
dark brown, good sized white head, a little lacing, sweet Aroma and not bitter. No aftertaste.

Dark beer, that looks like whisky. Somewhat "old" aroma. I cant find much in the taste. Only the aftertaste is slightly bitter and this remains for a while.

Donker, whisky kleurig bier. Ietwat muffig aroma. Niet veel in de smaak te herkennen, alleen de nasmaak is bitter en blijft aardig hangen.
Very malty. Excellent Belgian but not hoppy whatsoever. Strong and smooth on the palate.
Cherrywood, large white head; aroma of effervescent fruits; dark fruit, bready malts, hops and a gentle sweetness combine to make this a well-balanced and really good dubbel.
Bottle ino glass... Murky brownpour with off white head...  fruity aroma and taste... Pretty good for its style..

Appearance. Dark brown with a ecru head   Aroma dried fruit and raisins with an overtone of caramel. Taste of raisins and a metallic flavor. Long on the palate. Nice for a nice warm spring early evening
From a 33 cl bottle shared at home.  Pours a hazy brown with a frothy ecru head.  Malty nose.  Flavors of caramel and raisins.  Highly carbonated mouthfeel.  Slight metallic finish.

Uma cerveja espetacular, dubbel bélgica equilibradíssima, sabor e aroma intensos, toques de ameixa, tostado, castanha, a boca fica preenchida por sabores e texturas magníficas, recomendo somente aos amigos !
Pours hazy dark brown with huge off white head. Aroma of dried fruit and raisins. Taste is sweet of fruits with a smooth mouthfeel.

Brown dark chestnut colour, medium light mokka head, sweet haye herb vanilla smell, creamy refreshing hints of caramel and red fruits, but jet a coffee like bitterness, especialy in the aftertaste, difficult to place to taste exactly, medium carbonation,
Bottle. Pours a deep color bronze color with a light tan head. Not as lively as Prior 8. Very light caramel aroma. Medium/Light mouthfeel. Light caramel and bread flavors. Some metallic as well.

Reddish brown pour with modest fleckings of sediment. Clean, crisp head and a nose of ripe yeast and malts (though not especially heavy on the nuttiness that tends to frustrate me with some dubbels). Certainly its malty and has an emphasis on dark fruits, but as with the better examples of the style theres also a good bit of brightness for contrast. Not the kind of thing Ill go for all the time but damn solid.
Color medium brown. Smell of yeast and  something light metallic aroma. Taste malt, bread and hop.

Bouteille 330ml. De couleur brune-ambrée et légèrement voilée. Nez de levures fruitées (raisin, léger de cerises noires, notes de prunes et dagrumes) et légèrement épicées (clou de girofle, très légèrement poivré), de malt sucré du genre caramel avec des notes dalcool, de noix et de pain. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quune texture aux notes crémeuses. Goût de levures fruitées aux faibles notes acides (prunes, raisins, traces dagrumes) et légèrement épicées (dont des notes poivrées) lors de lentrée en bouche suivi dun goût de malt sucré de caramel avec un léger goût de pain grillé et des petites traces de sucre brun puis en finale lon retrouve une légère amertume de houblon herbeux avec de faibles notes dalcool. Post-goût moyen, composé dun léger goût de malt sucré avec des notes de levures fruitées, de houblon herbeux, de noix et dépices. (2006)

Pours a cloudy dark brwon brew with a medium sized white head with refular retention, aroma is moderate swwet and low bitter with prunes, plums and spices, medium bodied, flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and  moderate to low bitter with prunes, plums and spices, sweet finish.
Bottle 33 cl. Dark brown with a nice creamy offwhite head. Aroma of malt, choco and alc. Medium bitter taste with mild sweetnes, with a quite strong alc and caramel end.
September 2010. Pours brownish with a white head that quickly disappears. Spicy at first that finishes a bit sweet.
130413. Bottle at home. Pours hazy brown with a small head. Aroma Belgian yeast, some spices. Medium full bodied. Not Bad.
Dark brown, ample foam. Very bread-like, some raisin. Medium sweetness, hint of bitterness. Sint Bernardus products rank among my favourites, this one maybe their lightest and easiest one yet.

330ml bottle from Drinkswell, Ripon. Pours a dark brown-ruby amber colour, frothy tan head that gradually diminishes leaving some lacing and aroma of spice, plum fruit & yeast.  Taste is fruity malt caramel, vanilla, yeast with banana notes and a spicy lingering bitterness. Initial sweetness, some fizz, a slightly oily mouth feel, light to medium bodied, high carbonation, dry finish. Quite drinkable.
Aroma of spicy dark fruit, perhaps plum and raisin with cardamom.   Flaour adds an enveloping rich maltiness and a gentle balancing hint of spicy bitterness

Bottle from Julios. Medium brown color. Light tan head that settles to a thin lace. Somewhat fruity aromas and flavors. Mouthfeel is on the thin side. Sweet-earthy notes. Good overall, but not stellar.

Bottle from Beer Cellar Singapore. What a wonderful beer. Tough to describe it beyond "beautiful". It's taste belies its strength.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0.33l bottle from beermerchants.com This is a light blurry deep amber - almost brown - one with a massive great looking and almost everlasting heavy lacing off-white head. Its somewhat bready at first on the aroma. Then it evolves to a more Belgian yeast thing with candy, cellar, dark fruits and some saw dust. Nice. It has a average big-bubbly carbonation level and a nice oily texture. Flavors also at first a bit bready and some sawdust. Quite strange actually, almost like a low alco beer, just 10x better of course. Light and mild yeasty, some sweetness here, caramel, it some how tastes really nutty towards the finish. I quite enjoyed this one even it it first came off almost a bit weird. 09.06.2012

lighter brown colour (compared to St Bernadus Prior 8), moderate beige head; aroma of fruits (mostly plum), candy sugar and spicy alcohol; taste of brown sugar, yeast, some bitterness and well hidden alcohol; not as good as Prior, but still OK
Brown color with cremy beige head. Caramel malt aroma. At taste is full bodied and light sweet.

Bottle. Pours brown-reddish with a large  off-white head that dissipates quite fast. Aroma of malt and spices. Taste adds even more spices and nuts. Bitter and malty aftertaste. Lots of carbonation - too much for my taste. Disappointingly weak taste for a dubbel. I expected more.

Bottle.  Dark brown pour, little lasting head and an aroma of light candi sugar and plums.  Flavor is similar to the 8, just a little dialed back on the alcohol, but still nice balance of dark fruits, medium malt and caramel sweetness on the finish.

Flaska från Systembolaget. Djupt rubinröd färg med ett tjockt skum som ligger kvar. Doft av frukt, dadlar och honung. Sötman återkommer i smaken men klingar av relativt snabbt. Tunnare munkänsla än förväntat. Men summerat blir det en bra öl.
Like most St. Bernardus beers, this is one of the best examples of the style. Dark fruit, caramel. Medium to heavy body.  Slightly sweet flavor and a rich finish.

Pours a amber color, clear liquid and a white rocky head.
The smell was hard to detect. I think herbs and bit leather smell.
The taste wasnt very special. A light bitterness. Light body and a thin and watery texture. The carbo was lively to fizzy.

Uploading old ratings that were missing comments. Didn't enjoy this one. Too yeasty and nutty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 330ml. Pours beautifull brown/deep with creamy beige head. Aroma is of malt, caramel, citrus, sweetness. Taste is of malt, medium sweet, caramel, citrus, hops, belgian yeast and a rather long dry and slightly bitter finish. Palate: Medium body, average carbonation. Overall: Very good, tasty. Interesting body and balance. A serious beer, with a reasonnable abv.

Bottle poured into a shaker. Pours a super cloudy nut brown with a half finger of thick white head.  Aroma of dark fruits, bready yeast, and some light banana. Taste is quite similar. Light sweet with dark fermented fruits and loads of bready yeast.  Full bodied with a creamy texture. Fizzy carbonation and a super long finish.  Overall,  awesome. I understand how the monks could handle not eating while drinking this stuff.
Bottle at Café de ZaaierHazy brown, light brown head. Malt, overripe fruit, dark fruit. Medium body, rather low carbo.

330ml bottle - Pours a hazy medium brown colour with medium layer of quickly dissipating white head. Aroma is light, sweet and brown sugary, with hints of grapes and raisins. Flavour and mouthfeel light and a bit watery, but also very carbonated in the mouth. Slightly tart and bitter with some orange and toffee flavours. Overall, pretty good.

Bottle 330ml.
Pours beautifull brown/deep amber with huge creamy beige head.Good lacing. Aroma is of malt, caramel, citrus, sweetness, fruits. Taste is of malt, caramel, citrus, hops, fruits, belgian yeast. Palate: Medium body. Overall: Very good, tasty. Interesting body and balance. A serious beer, with a reasonnable abv.

Bottle 33 cl, BBE 25.03.2014. Pours brown in color with a fluffy off-white head, which stays on as a cap for quite a while. Bready malts, some yeast and perhaps some darker fruits are to be found in aroma. Dark bready in taste, some raisins and plums as well. Light nuttyness in aftertaste. Bready malts and them darker fruits in finish as well. Felt a bit one-dimensional at first, but fortunately got better towards the end and thus gets a bit higher score. Light darker fruitiness coming through in finish as well.

Pours a deep copper color with a tan head that leaves continuous lace.  The aroma is spicy and sweet with a warm malt, and the flavor is crisp and bright.  There are allspice and cinnamon notes, some citrus, a light caramel quality, and rich malt.  Very good.

In the glass, its a dark brown colour with a thin tan head. Great nose, with toffee, spice, fresh apple, dried fruit and a touch of vinegar. The body is a little thinner than expected, but still delivers a decent whack of spice, followed by apple, plums, lemon and a little brown sugar sweetness. Lingering finish - pretty good overall.

Bottle. Brown, surprisingly murky. Darkish candi, dark fruits, yeast. Lots of sweetish plums, malts, Body is full, dark candi sugar, a bit of bitterness, some roasted tones. Quite good, excellent actually. Compared to the its siblings, it is of course a bit lighter. But excellent dark candi flavours, with a nice, assertive and cleansing, bitterness. Not as dark fruity as some of the other lighter dark abbey ales, but good nontheless.

average creamy frothy offwhite head. good lacing. mostly diminishing. flat thick brown body. aroma: alcohol, malt, chocolate. if: moderate sweet. ff: moderate sweet light bitter; long duration. palate: medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, metallic finish. dulçor maltado e achocolatado, combinando com a aparência instigante, leve amargor gredoso vem a tona no final, bem como um leve aquecimento alcoólico, 80 s

Its not the greatest "dubbel" i had and i didnt like it all the first and second time, but i started to grow on it a little better. It has the same characteristics of the 8 and 12, but weaker and more mellow. It has a better balance then the 8 and lacks the complexity of the 12.

pours hazy light brown with a very nice off-white head, excellent retention and lacing. yeasty - earthy and lightly dusty, caramel, spices - maybe coriander hint, fruits. hint of sweetness. light but present grassy-herbal finish, lively and and soft carbonation, light body - oily. nothing outstanding but good in every aspect.

Nice dubbel. Aroma has florals, nice sweet malt flavour. Pours amber clear with good head and lacing. Carbonation a little below average, bit good for style. Nice palate. Leave is sweet and perfumy. Tap at Coles.

0.33l bottle, served in a chalice. Appearance: Opaque brown, tiny beige head, minimal carbonation. Aroma: Malts, grapes, bread, banana. Palate: thick bodied, syrupy, minimal carbonation. Taste: sweet, with a long finish. Really really nice and complex.
Pours a dark brown colour, candy like taste, yeasty and rich. Slight spice and maltiness on the palate

First time I had this beer I was already drunk, and even so I noticed a completely amazing taste, it was the best beer of the night!! Am not a specialist... what I can say is that this beer has an awesome flavour, red color, probably w/ red fruits... well, it's a very very good beer!!! Good value for money...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Brown with red tints and a creamy tan head. Aroma is not particularly aggressive. Some dark fruit and a little banana/clove the later of which really comes out in the flavor. A well made dubbel.

330ml bottle into a goblet.

Pours a slightly hazy dark brown due to the sediment that got into the glass with a half finger fluffy white head. Really good head retention and decent lacing.

Aroma is a little bit weak but I really can pick out brown sugar and vanilla. There is also a slightly musty odor but it is more complimentary than it is distracting.

The brown sugar is more muted in the flavor allowing the the banana/clove Belgian yeast character to shine through. More vanilla that is subdued but there is a noticeable lack of complexity compared to some other versions of the style. Mouthfeel is on the watery side with a little bit of stickyness left on the finish.

Overall, I am not very impressed by this Dubbel. It really lacks complexity and depth of flavor along with a weak mouthfeel. I feel like this could be a whole lot better with a little bit of work.

Brown colour, and medium and fast disappearing beige head. Aroma is chocolate, wood and sweet of some red fruit. Taste is woody, but quite sweet and still fruity. Average carbonation.
The beer is good, but is far from the high quality of the 8 and 12.

Esto es una pedazo de cerveza. Siempre intento tener en casa. La combinación sabor, cuerpo, olor y alcohol la hace perfecta para casi cualquier momento. A pesar de que recomienda beber fría, yo la prefiero a medida que se va templando. Buenísima.
Not a huge fan of Trappist brews, but found this drinkable with a lingering taste, despite its relative strength. Will sample more from St.Bernardus !

Cherry and purple grape-like aromas, almost winey.  Beautiful, clear, dark ruby complexion, with an off-white head that retains well.  The taste is dry, with flavors of cherries, raisins, dark berries, and subtle vanilla.  Full bodied, rich, great, fluffy carbonation, spice, and a dry, fruity finish.  A delicious dubbel ale.
Bouteille 330 ml. Une bonne bière dabbaye, tout à fait sur le style et sans grande surprise. Malt, caramel, épices et levures.

11.2oz bottle. Best by 19/09/14. Dark clear red color, big poofy off-white / beige head. Good lace. Robust, complex nose. Banana, dark fruit. Bigger body. Smooth soft medium carbonation. More dry texture. Nice sweet taste. Dark fruit, light chocolate, kind of nutty toasty malts. Banana. Hint of apple peel isnt hard to see. Some herbal hops. Maybe I just dont have a palate for Dubbels, but I just had the Prior 8 before this and they are not all that different. Still just as good, though.

Hazy chestnut with good head and lacing.  Belgian yeast and malt aroma with some fruity esters.  Some funk from yeast with malt and some grain.  Moderate and slick mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pour is chestnut brown with big off white head.  Slightly carbonated and medium lacing.  Smell is Belgian yeast and malt with slight fruit undertone.  Taste is malt and yeast without the spiciness of the St Bernardus 12.  Good session beer.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20100619.
Pours dark brown color with a small off-white head. Aroma of caramel malts, toffee, some spice notes, yeast and hints of licorice. Flavor of spices, yeast, dark malts, caramel, toffee and some ripe fruits. Very nice.

Hazelnootbruin, zeer troebel bier met licht getinte schuimkraag. Geen duidelijk aroma: wat noten, malt, caramel, stroop? Opvallend aan de smaak is dat het iets licht zurigs heeft, verder het bekende zoetbittere van een dubbel. Prettig dik palet, zonder een melig mondgevoel. Prima dubbel.

UPDATED: JAN 12, 2013 Another brew from the always excellent St. Bernardus brewy. Pours somewhat brown but not dark brown with a nice and soft off-white head. Aroma is really subtle with a little nuts (WTF?) and bready notes. First sip is ridden with a not so pleasant metallic aftertaste. Blech. Once you overcome that and continue to drink on it is a pretty light brew that is nice to drink but not complex. Mouthfeel is really nice tho, fluffy and light. It is nice and malty with not much hops to speak of. Overall Id say that this is the one I enjoyed the least from their range but it is still quite good for what it is!

Appearance: dark brown, creamy head dissipates quickly

Aroma: aroma of sweetness and fruit

Taste: sweet and creamy

Palate: good bit of c02 burn, slightest bit of bitterness at the end if you really concentrate 

Overall: really similar to the 8 and 12, good beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Brown color with white head. Aroma: toffee, malt, some dark fruit. Taste is malty, dark fruit with some sweetness and a little bitter finish. Good Abbey Dubbel, will try it again.
Pours brown with foamy head and little lacing. Aromas are toffee, cereal, some dark fruit. Tastes are light sweet. Body is medium to light. Lighter than Id prefer for style.

pours an almost opaque brown.thick tan head.malty,yeasty,,raisins,and toffee aromas.flavor is malt,grape and has qualities of a belgium sour.heavy carbonation.medium body,and has a fizzy,tanic finish.drinkable but not overy enjoyable
Brown with white head.  Spicy aroma.  Sweet caramel flavor followed by yeast spice.  Nice
Bottle. Pours a hazy dark brown with a moderate white head. Nose is slightly sweet and yeasty. Taste has some of that sweetness that is characteristic of the style.

Pours dark amber. With small head. Honey soy sauce aroma. Malt with bitter finish. Overall a dissapointment for a Trappist. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Middle of the road. No major flavors stand out. Very zesty on the tongue but the finish is lacking. A fizzy beer with a creamy finish but little in the way of taste.
pours a dark brown color with a medium head. Nice brown sugar, and toffee taste. Has hints of raisin and wood.

33 cl bottle @ home, BBE 18.01.2013
Aroma has raisins, orange peel, burned sugar and some toffee typical to aged Belgian ales. Flavour has raisins, toffee, some orange peel, spices and hints of herbs. Palate is a bit too high on CO2. Well preserved, perhaps even matured a little.
Goed bierke dat wel iets minder is dan zijn grotere broers ( de st-Bernardus 8 en 12) maar nog steeds een aanrader voor de bierliefhebbers!

Bottle. Mahogany brown with red highlights. Very fruity aroma, mostly tropical fruits and some nutty malts. Taste is again fruity, more dark fruitys, chewy malts. Slight roastiness edges the sweetness. Very good balance. Full bodied but not too heavy with medium-lively carbonation. Top of the style.

Cherry, with slightly tart yeasty aroma. Deep opaque brown, with a thin foamy head. Taste is well balanced, a touch of malty sweetness somewhat masked by the carbonation, with a softly bitter finish. Medium, body, very highly carbonated. Overall, a solid dubbel, but not as exceptional as their abt 12.
Chestnut coloured with a full and creamy head. Malt, coffee and caramel notes. Malty flavour, slightly fruity, coffee, chocolate. Full body. Sweet finish. Little bittneress (but still balanced).

Murky brown colour with a bubbely off white head. Acidic, yeast and fruity aroma. Balanced sweetness and a low bitterness. Medium pluss body. Fruity, acidic and a bit vinous flavour. Light spicy. Well carbonated.[Bottle from Utobeer Market Stall at Borough (London), England]

Refrigerated 11.2 oz. bottles poured into a trappist glass.  Pours dark brown with medium beige head.  Thick small bubble lacing, medium body, well carbonated, and light molasses aroma.  Taste is dark candy sugar, caramel, some dark fruit (mostly prune with a little raisin), and molasses.  Good, but lighter in dark fruit flavor compared to others.
33cl bottle from cervezalandia. Medium to high carbonation. Brown/copper color. Medium to high head. Medium sweetness and low bitterness. Malty, caramel aroma.

Bottle (341 ml). Clear copper with a medium off-white head whos lasting forever and some lacing. Light aroma of dark fruits, nuts, caramel and slight spices. Taste is also soft and sweet and about the same as aroma. Thin body, almost watery. Overall, this is a nice extremely drinkable Dubbel.

bottle   - poured clear chestnut brow with foamy off white head  . Aroma is bread caramel  some roasted notes  and a little dark fruits .  Sweet toffee / dark fruit taste to start  then becoming more tart and nice dry finish   . flavour lingers on the palate a long time   some warmth follows .  full carbonation  mouthfeel is light and clean  - perhaps thinner than one would expect  .  a nice drinkable ale

Look: Dark brown, light khaki lacing. Smell: Sweet malt, roasted candied pecans, spicy cinnamon bread, caramel, cellar floor, very yeasty. Taste: Follows the aroma, citrus tart, barnyard funk, bitterness, dry finish. Feel: Light body, Tight carbonation. Overall: The aroma is deceiving. You believe youre getting a sweet brew. Nothing is further from the truth. This is one funky treat. This is like a roasted nuttier Gueuze. Im not complaining. This was a surprise, caught me off guard. This will not be my last. This brew is worthy.

I am user no.1001 to rate this beer!!!
Cannot give much of a good mark on appearance, as I had a lousy glass (the WRONG shape) and the head was just excessively foamy. Nice brown cloudiness though. It has wonderful aromas of mid winter, an old barn with decaying fruits, sileage, plums and berries. Wow! The flavours are the same, following the bouquet - so mellow and sweet, caramel, fruity, hayish, a bit acidic, old curtains, but nothing to spoil the smooth roundness of this beer. Palate is a bit astringent, oily. Quite frankly, if the catholic church wants more souls to its ranks, they could stop hailing virginity and maybe hand this beer out at masses.

Pours a deep chestnut color with eggshell foam that settles quickly. On the nose it rustic and inviting... dark fruit, caramel sweetness and some toasted notes. On the palate its alot of the same with some nice yeasty tartness added to the deep fig and toasted nut flavors. A nice lil touch of bitterness on the finish cleans up the sweetness and makes you want to drink more !

Bottle. Pour is hazy deep brown, huge off-white head, good retention/lace. Aroma of belgo yeast, raisin, prune, caramel, nuts. Taste is mildly sweet, raisin, prune, caramel, slightly tart yeast. Palate is super dry, high carbonation, dry finish. Interesting.

Le St. Bernardus non deludono mai. Nel bicchiere si presenta marroncina con un bel cappello di schiuma persistente. Aroma maltato, fruttato e un pò legnoso. Al palato ingresso sontuoso e complesso con note di frutta secca, malto torbato e un qualcosa di fruttato dolce. Finale secco e leggermente amaro. Un bel esempio di dubbel.

This Abbey Ale proves why Abbeys are renowned for top quality. On the poor you get a nice seasoned and nutty aroma with a chestnut color. The taste of this fine Ale supersedes the aroma (which is already amazing)! It has a full body with a flavor of roasted nuts and a lingering palate that drives you to sip after sip! Perfect for a nice cold winter day!

Poured from a bottle into a Trappist glass. Dark, murky brown pour with a beige head of smooth foam. The aroma is malty and raisiny. Taste is sweet and fruity. Not quite as good as I had hoped or expected.
Très bonne bière, une discrétion dans le goût. Une très belle couleur et un palais très agréable.

Bottle 0,33l at Oliver Twist in Stockholm. Dark amber colour. It pours with a medium cream head that diminshes to a very small lacing. Aroma of caramel and raisins. Taste of caramel and some dark fruits with a bit of spice, some hint of banana. A bit of yeast on the finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark chesnut colour with a tall frothy off-white head. Aroma is dark fruits, yeast and spices. Taste is also fruity with caramel, yeast and some light hop bitterness but overall a little bit watery. Mouth feel is quite fizzy, a little too much for my liking. Pretty decent but not thoroughly impressed. In no way compares to the 12 which is amazing.

An excellent beer. Really nice, very dirnkable but wonderfully complex at the same time. Aroma is yeasty and tastes a bit like cereal. Appearance is a murky brown, reminds me of mahongany. Taste is nice and malty, but I cant really pick it exactly, it reminds me a bit of their 8, but crossed with Orval, very interesting. Not as much going on in the palate, but it is definitely malty and sweet, but still very pleasant, bit of the taste hang around. Overall, a very nice and very drinkable beer.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2013 Cloudy deep brown, with large beige head.
Aroma.. Fruity, caramel malty, bread.
Light sweet flavour with some roasted malts, bit licorice. Refreshing.
Thou high carbonation spoils enjoying this beer.

Bottle at home (from Spar in Popperinge) 21/10/12.
Pours a slightly obscured chestnut brown with an off white head that soon forms a small pond and clears to the edges.
Nose is toffee, nuts, wood tones, varnish, caramelised sugars, dates and plums.
Tastes of dark fruits, candied sugars, toffee, wedding cake, alcohol fairly well hidden.
As with all the St Bernardus beers I feel this is a little over carbonated. Medium bodied with spritzy carbonation leading to a sweet finish.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Pours a dark cloudy brown with a medium tan head, which slowly fades to a razor thin head that lasts through out with some light lacing. Aroma of rich roasted caramel malt, gark fruits, some Belgian yeast with bready notes. Taste same as aroma with some mild bitter notes and light nutty flavor. Palate is a medium body, a balanced sweet nutty bitter  smooth mouth feel, with good lively carbonation.
